About	O

Alliance	O
Resources	O
Ltd	O
is	O
an	O

projects	O

and	O
Western	O
Australia.	O

flagship	O
project	O
is	O
the	O
Wilcherry	O
Project	O
,	O
located	O
within	O
the	O
southern	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
Gawler	O
Craton	O
,	O
approximately	O
45	O
km	O
north	O
of	O
the	O
township	O
of	O
Kimba	O
,	O
South	O
Australia.	O

Mineral	O

estimate	O
for	O
the	O
Weednanna	O
Gold	O
Deposit	O
,	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
Wilcherry	O
Project	O

g/t	O
gold	O

oz	O

for	O
details	O
concerning	O
the	O
Mineral	O

.	O

During	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
,	O
Alliance	O
completed	O
the	O
sale	O
of	O
Alliance	O
Craton	O
Explorer	O
Pty	O
Ltd's	O
(	O
ACE	O
’	O
s	O
)	O

in	O

Project	O
in	O
South	O

,	O
including	O

’	O
s	O
share	O
of	O
uranium	O
oxide	O

already	O
mined	O
,	O
for	O
a	O
total	O
consideration	O
of	O
$73.975	O
million	O
(	O
Sale	O
)	O
.	O

Alliance	O
applied	O
to	O
the	O
Australian	O
Taxation	O
Office	O
for	O
a	O
Class	O
Ruling	O
to	O
confirm	O
that	O
the	O
full	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
distribution	O
represents	O
a	O
Capital	O
Return	O
,	O
with	O
no	O
portion	O
deemed	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
dividend	O
from	O
profits.	O
This	O
Class	O
Ruling	O
2015/81	O
was	O
subsequently	O
issued.	O
A	O
General	O
Meeting	O
of	O
Alliance	O
was	O
held	O
in	O
Melbourne	O
on	O
11	O
September	O
2015	O
at	O
which	O
shareholders	O
approved	O
the	O
Sale	O
and	O
a	O
return	O
of	O
capital	O
of	O
$0.12	O
per	O
share	O
for	O
each	O
share	O
held	O
on	O
the	O
Record	O
Date.	O
The	O
Sale	O
completed	O
on	O
18	O
September	O
2015.	O
On	O
12	O
October	O
2015	O
,	O
trading	O
in	O
Alliance	O
shares	O
began	O
on	O
an	O
‘	O
ex	O
capital	O
return	O
basis	O
’	O
.	O

The	O
Record	O
date	O
for	O
the	O
Capital	O
Return	O
was	O
14	O
October	O
2015.	O
Processing	O
of	O
payments	O
totalling	O
$50.06	O
million	O
commenced	O
on	O
28	O
October	O
2015.	O
The	O
Class	O
Ruling	O
noted	O
that	O
:	O
“	O
Alliance	O
will	O
not	O
return	O
capital	O
of	O
any	O
more	O
than	O
$0.12	O
per	O
share	O
at	O
this	O
time	O
until	O
Alliance	O
has	O
determined	O
its	O
tax	O
liability	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
the	O
Sale	O
,	O
which	O
will	O
not	O
be	O
finalised	O
until	O
after	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
income	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2016.	O
”	O
Alliance	O
recently	O
received	O
tax	O
advice	O
from	O
its	O
advisors	O
that	O
it	O
will	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
utilise	O
its	O

forward	O
tax	O

to	O

tax	O
gain	O

on	O

of	O
its	O

in	O

Mile	O
Uranium	O
Project	O

company	O
loss	O

test	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
,	O
being	O
the	O

of	O

to	O
enable	O

as	O

as	O
possible.	O

30	O

2016	O

million.	O

to	O

,	O
409	O
shares.	O
At	O
the	O
Monardes	O
copper-uranium	O
project	O
in	O
Chile	O
,	O

a	O

and	O

in	O

2016	O
11Directors'	O
report	O
The	O

Committee	O
has	O
structured	O
an	O
executive	O
The	O

and	O
reward	O
framework	O
has	O
four	O

framework	O
that	O
is	O
market	O

and	O
components	O
:	O
complementary	O
to	O
the	O
reward	O
strategy	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
s	O
base	O
pay	O
and	O
non-monetary	O
benefits	O
and	O
company.	O
s	O
short-term	O
performance	O
incentives	O
s	O
share-based	O
payments	O
The	O
reward	O
framework	O
is	O
designed	O
to	O
align	O
executive	O
reward	O
to	O
s	O
other	O
remuneration	O
such	O
as	O
superannuation	O
and	O
long	O
service	O
shareholders'	O
interests.	O
The	O
Board	O
have	O
considered	O
that	O
it	O
should	O
leave	O
seek	O
to	O
enhance	O
shareholders'	O
interests	O
by	O
:	O
The	O
combination	O
of	O
these	O
comprises	O
the	O
executive's	O
total	O
s	O
having	O
economic	O
profit	O
as	O

of	O
plan	O
design	O

on	O

growth	O
in	O

wealth	O
,	O
consisting	O
of	O
dividends	O
and	O
growth	O
in	O
share	O
price	O
,	O
and	O
delivering	O
constant	O
Fixed	O

,	O

of	O
base	O

,	O

and	O
or	O
increasing	O
return	O
on	O
assets	O
as	O

as	O

executive	O

are	O
reviewed	O
annually	O
by	O
the	O

on	O

non-financial	O
drivers	O
of	O

Committee	O
,	O

on	O
individual	O
and	O
business	O
unit	O
performance	O
,	O
the	O
s	O
attracting	O
and	O
retaining	O
high	O
calibre	O
executives	O
overall	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
and	O
comparable	O
market	O
remuneration.	O
Additionally	O
,	O
the	O
reward	O
framework	O
should	O
seek	O
to	O
enhance	O
executives'	O
interests	O
by	O
:	O

can	O

in	O

form	O
of	O

(	O

s	O

competitive	O
reward	O
for	O
contribution	O
to	O
growth	O
in	O
does	O
not	O
create	O
any	O
additional	O
cost	O
to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
and	O
shareholder	O
wealth	O
adds	O
additional	O
value	O
to	O
the	O
executive.	O
s	O
providing	O
a	O
clear	O
structure	O
for	O
earning	O
rewards	O
The	O
short-term	O
incentive	O
(	O
'STI'	O
)	O
program	O
is	O
designed	O
to	O
align	O
the	O
In	O
accordance	O
with	O
best	O
practice	O
corporate	O
governance	O
,	O
the	O
targets	O
of	O
the	O
business	O
units	O
with	O
the	O
targets	O
of	O
those	O
executives	O
in	O
structure	O
of	O
non-executive	O
director	O
and	O
executive	O
remuneration	O
are	O
charge	O
of	O
meeting	O
those	O
targets.	O
STI	O
payments	O
are	O
granted	O
to	O
separate.	O
executives	O
based	O
on	O
specific	O
annual	O
targets	O
and	O

1.	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
Principles	O
of	O
consolidation	O
The	O
principal	O
accounting	O
policies	O
adopted	O
in	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
incorporate	O
the	O
assets	O
and	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
set	O
out	O
either	O
in	O
the	O
respective	O
notes	O
or	O
liabilities	O
of	O
all	O
subsidiaries	O
of	O
Alliance	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
(	O
'company'	O
below.	O
These	O
policies	O
have	O
been	O
consistently	O
applied	O
to	O
all	O
the	O
years	O
or	O
'parent	O
entity'	O
)	O
as	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
and	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
all	O
presented	O
,	O
unless	O
otherwise	O
stated.	O
subsidiaries	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
then	O
ended.	O
Alliance	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
together	O
are	O
referred	O
to	O
in	O
these	O
financial	O
New	O
,	O
revised	O
or	O
amending	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
statements	O
as	O
the	O
'consolidated	O
entity'.	O
Interpretations	O
adopted	O
Subsidiaries	O
are	O
all	O
those	O
entities	O
over	O
which	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
adopted	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
,	O
revised	O
or	O
has	O
control.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
controls	O
an	O
entity	O
when	O
the	O
amending	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
,	O
or	O
has	O
rights	O
to	O
,	O
variable	O
returns	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
(	O
'AASB'	O
)	O
that	O
are	O
from	O
its	O
involvement	O
with	O
the	O
entity	O
and	O
has	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
affect	O
mandatory	O
for	O
the	O
current	O
reporting	O
period.	O
those	O
returns	O
through	O
its	O
power	O
to	O
direct	O
the	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
entity.	O
Subsidiaries	O
are	O
fully	O
consolidated	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
on	O
which	O
control	O
is	O
New	O
and	O
amended	O
standards	O
transferred	O
to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
They	O
are	O
de-consolidated	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
elected	O
to	O
apply	O
AASB	O
9	O
Financial	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
control	O
ceases.	O
Instrumentsas	O
issued	O
in	O
December	O
2014	O
,	O
because	O
the	O
new	O
Intercompany	O
transactions	O
,	O
balances	O
and	O
unrealised	O
gains	O
on	O
accounting	O
policies	O
provide	O
more	O
reliable	O
and	O
relevant	O
information	O
transactions	O
between	O
entities	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
are	O
for	O
users	O
to	O
assess	O
the	O
amounts	O
,	O
timing	O
and	O
uncertainty	O
of	O
future	O
eliminated.	O
Unrealised	O
losses	O
are	O
also	O
eliminated	O
unless	O
the	O
cash	O
flows.	O
In	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
transitional	O
provisions	O
in	O
AASB	O
transaction	O
provides	O
evidence	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
9	O
(	O
7.2	O
)	O
,	O
the	O
entity	O
has	O
chosen	O
to	O
restate	O
comparatives.	O
See	O
note	O
6	O
transferred.	O
Accounting	O
policies	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
have	O
been	O
changed	O
for	O
further	O
details	O
on	O
the	O
impact	O
of	O
the	O
change	O
in	O
accounting	O
policy.	O
where	O
necessary	O
to	O
ensure	O
consistency	O
with	O
the	O
policies	O
adopted	O
Basis	O
of	O
preparation	O
by	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
These	O
general	O
purpose	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
Current	O
and	O
non-current	O
classification	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O

NOTE	O
11.	O
CURRENT	O
ASSETS	O
-	O

TRADE	O
AND	O
OTHER	O
RECEIVABLES	O
Trade	O
receivables	O
-	O

1	O
,	O
800	O
Accrued	O
revenue	O
26	O
,	O
950	O
1	O
,	O
289	O
GST	O
receivable	O
15	O
,	O
791	O
104	O
,	O
432	O
42	O
,	O
741	O
107	O
,	O
521	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
trade	O
and	O
other	O
receivables	O
Trade	O
receivables	O
are	O
initially	O
recognised	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
and	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method	O
,	O
less	O
any	O
provision	O
for	O
impairment.	O
Trade	O
receivables	O
are	O
generally	O
due	O
for	O
settlement	O
within	O
30	O
days.	O
Collectability	O
of	O
trade	O
receivables	O
is	O
reviewed	O
on	O
an	O
ongoing	O
basis.	O
Debts	O
which	O
are	O
known	O
to	O
be	O
uncollectable	O
are	O
written	O
off	O
by	O
reducing	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
directly.	O
A	O
provision	O
for	O
impairment	O
of	O
trade	O
receivables	O
is	O
raised	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
objective	O
evidence	O
that	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
will	O
not	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
collect	O
all	O
amounts	O
due	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
original	O
terms	O
of	O
the	O
receivables.	O
Significant	O
financial	O
difficulties	O
of	O
the	O
debtor	O
,	O
probability	O
that	O
the	O
debtor	O
will	O
enter	O
bankruptcy	O
or	O
financial	O
reorganisation	O
and	O
default	O
or	O
delinquency	O
in	O
payments	O
(	O
more	O
than	O
60	O
days	O
overdue	O
)	O
are	O
considered	O
indicators	O
that	O
the	O
trade	O
receivable	O
may	O
be	O
impaired.	O
The	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
allowance	O
is	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
asset's	O
carrying	O
amount	O
and	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
estimated	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
,	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
original	O
effective	O
interest	O
rate.	O
Cash	O
flows	O
relating	O
to	O
short-term	O
receivables	O
are	O
not	O
discounted	O
if	O
the	O
effect	O
of	O
discounting	O
is	O
immaterial.	O
Other	O
receivables	O
are	O
recognised	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
,	O
less	O
any	O
provision	O
for	O
impairment.	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
Goods	O
&	O
Services	O
Tax	O
(	O
‘	O
GST	O
’	O
)	O
and	O
other	O
similar	O
taxes	O
Revenues	O
,	O
expenses	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
net	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
associated	O
GST	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
GST	O
incurred	O
is	O
not	O
recoverable	O
from	O
the	O
tax	O
authority.	O
In	O
this	O
case	O
it	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
the	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
expense.	O
Receivables	O
and	O
payables	O
are	O
stated	O
inclusive	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
receivable	O
or	O
payable.	O
The	O
net	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
tax	O
authority	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
other	O
receivables	O
or	O
other	O
payables	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position.	O
Cash	O
flows	O
are	O
presented	O
on	O
a	O
gross	O
basis.	O
The	O
GST	O
components	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
arising	O
from	O
investing	O
or	O
financing	O
activities	O
which	O
are	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
the	O
tax	O
authority	O
,	O
are	O
presented	O
as	O
operating	O
cash	O
flows.	O
Commitments	O
and	O
contingencies	O
are	O
disclosed	O
net	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
tax	O
authority.	O

respective	O
area	O
of	O
interest.	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
separate	O
areas	O
of	O
interest	O
for	O
which	O
rights	O
of	O
tenure	O
are	O
current	O
is	O
carried	O
forward	O
as	O
an	O
asset	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
where	O
it	O
is	O
expected	O
that	O
the	O
expenditure	O
will	O
be	O
recovered	O
through	O
the	O
successful	O
development	O
and	O
exploitation	O
of	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
,	O
or	O
by	O
its	O
sale	O
;	O
or	O
exploration	O
activities	O
are	O
continuing	O
in	O
an	O
area	O
and	O
activities	O
have	O
not	O
reached	O
a	O
stage	O
which	O
permits	O
a	O
reasonable	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
existence	O
or	O
otherwise	O
of	O
economically	O

reserves.	O

in	O

year	O
in	O

the	O
decision	O
is	O

Ordinary	O
shares	O
Ordinary	O
shares	O
entitle	O
the	O
holder	O
to	O
participate	O
in	O
dividends	O
and	O
the	O
proceeds	O
on	O
the	O
winding	O
up	O
of	O
the	O
company	O
in	O
proportion	O
to	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
and	O
amounts	O
paid	O
on	O
the	O
shares	O
held.	O
The	O
fully	O
paid	O
ordinary	O
shares	O
have	O
no	O
par	O
value	O
and	O
the	O
company	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
a	O
limited	O
amount	O
of	O
authorised	O
capital.	O
On	O
a	O
show	O
of	O
hands	O
every	O
member	O
present	O
at	O
a	O
meeting	O
in	O
person	O
or	O
by	O
proxy	O
shall	O
have	O
one	O
vote	O
and	O
upon	O
a	O
poll	O
each	O
share	O
shall	O
have	O
one	O
vote.	O
Share	O
buy-back	O
There	O
is	O
no	O
current	O
on-market	O
share	O
buy-back.	O
Capital	O
risk	O
management	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
objectives	O
when	O
managing	O
capital	O
are	O
to	O
safeguard	O
its	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
so	O
that	O
it	O
can	O
provide	O
returns	O
for	O
shareholders	O
and	O
benefits	O
for	O
other	O
stakeholders	O
and	O
to	O
maintain	O
an	O
optimum	O
capital	O
structure	O
to	O
reduce	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
capital.	O
Capital	O
is	O
regarded	O
as	O
total	O
equity	O
,	O
as	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
,	O
plus	O
net	O
debt.	O
Net	O
debt	O
is	O
calculated	O
as	O
total	O
borrowings	O
less	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents.	O
In	O
order	O
to	O
maintain	O
or	O
adjust	O
the	O
capital	O
structure	O
,	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
may	O
issue	O
new	O
shares	O
or	O
sell	O
assets	O
to	O
reduce	O
debt.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
would	O
look	O
to	O
raise	O
capital	O
when	O
an	O
opportunity	O
to	O
invest	O
in	O
a	O
business	O
or	O
company	O
was	O
seen	O
as	O
value	O
adding	O
relative	O
to	O
the	O
current	O
parent	O
entity's	O
share	O
price	O
at	O
the	O
time	O
of	O
the	O
investment.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
is	O
actively	O
pursuing	O
additional	O
investments	O
in	O
the	O
short	O
term	O
to	O
supplement	O
its	O
existing	O
businesses	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
maximise	O
synergies.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
is	O
not	O
subject	O
to	O
any	O
financing	O
arrangement	O
covenants.	O
The	O
capital	O
risk	O
management	O
policy	O
remains	O
unchanged	O
from	O
the	O
30	O
June	O
2015	O
Annual	O
Report.	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
issued	O
capital	O

options	O

shown	O

FINANCIAL	O
INSTRUMENTS	O
Financial	O
risk	O
management	O
objectives	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
activities	O
expose	O
it	O
to	O
a	O
variety	O
of	O
financial	O
risks	O
:	O
market	O
risk	O
(	O
including	O
foreign	O
currency	O
risk	O
,	O
price	O
risk	O
and	O
interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
)	O
,	O
credit	O
risk	O
and	O
liquidity	O
risk.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
overall	O
risk	O
management	O
program	O
focuses	O
on	O
the	O
unpredictability	O
of	O
financial	O
markets	O
and	O
seeks	O
to	O
minimise	O
potential	O
adverse	O
effects	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
uses	O
different	O
methods	O
to	O
measure	O
different	O
types	O
of	O
risk	O
to	O
which	O
it	O
is	O
exposed.	O
These	O
methods	O
include	O
sensitivity	O
analysis	O
in	O
the	O
case	O
of	O
interest	O
rate	O
,	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
and	O
other	O
price	O
risks	O
,	O
ageing	O
analysis	O
for	O
credit	O
risk	O
and	O
beta	O
analysis	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
investment	O
portfolios	O
to	O
determine	O
market	O
risk.	O
Risk	O
management	O
is	O
carried	O
out	O
by	O
senior	O
finance	O
executives	O
(	O
'finance'	O
)	O
under	O
policies	O
approved	O
by	O
the	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
(	O
'the	O
Board'	O
)	O
.	O

These	O
policies	O
include	O
identification	O
and	O
analysis	O
of	O
the	O
risk	O
exposure	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
and	O
appropriate	O
procedures	O
,	O
controls	O
and	O
risk	O
limits.	O
Finance	O
identifies	O
,	O
evaluates	O
and	O
hedges	O
financial	O
risks	O
within	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
operating	O
units.	O
Finance	O
reports	O
to	O
the	O
Board	O
on	O
a	O
monthly	O
basis.	O
Market	O
risk	O
Foreign	O
currency	O
risk	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
undertakes	O
certain	O
transactions	O
denominated	O
in	O
foreign	O
currency	O
and	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
foreign	O
currency	O
risk	O
through	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
rate	O
fluctuations.	O
Foreign	O
exchange	O
risk	O
arises	O
from	O
future	O
commercial	O
transactions	O
and	O
recognised	O
financial	O
assets	O
and	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
denominated	O
in	O
a	O
currency	O
that	O
is	O
not	O
the	O
entity's	O
functional	O
currency.	O
The	O
risk	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
sensitivity	O
analysis	O
and	O
cash	O
flow	O
forecasting.	O
Foreign	O
exchange	O
risk	O
arises	O
from	O
future	O
commitments	O
,	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
that	O
are	O
denominated	O
in	O
a	O
currency	O
that	O
is	O
not	O
the	O
Company's	O
functional	O
currency.	O
The	O
Company	O
operates	O
in	O
Australia	O
and	O
Chile	O
and	O
at	O
present	O
has	O
minimal	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
exposure.	O
The	O
Company	O
will	O
potentially	O
have	O
greater	O
exposure	O
in	O
the	O
future	O
as	O
most	O
commodities	O
the	O
Company	O
explores	O
for	O
are	O
traded	O
in	O
US	O
Dollars.	O
Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
is	O
the	O
risk	O
that	O
the	O
Company's	O
financial	O
position	O
will	O
be	O
adversely	O
affected	O
by	O
movements	O
in	O
interest	O
rates.	O
Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
on	O
short	O
term	O
deposits	O
is	O
not	O
considered	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
material	O
risk	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
short	O
term	O
nature	O
of	O
these	O
financial	O
instruments.	O

Credit	O
risk	O

its	O

entity.	O

a	O

,	O

,	O

to	O

Liquidity	O
risk	O

Fair	O

FAIR	O
VALUE	O
MEASUREMENT	O
Fair	O
value	O
hierarchy	O
The	O
following	O
tables	O
detail	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
,	O
measured	O
or	O
disclosed	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
using	O
a	O
three	O
level	O
hierarchy	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
lowest	O
level	O
of	O
input	O
that	O
is	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
entire	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
,	O
being	O
:	O
Level	O
1	O
:	O
Quoted	O
prices	O
(	O
unadjusted	O
)	O
in	O
active	O
markets	O
for	O
identical	O
assets	O
or	O
liabilities	O
that	O
the	O
entity	O
can	O
access	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date	O
Level	O
2	O
:	O
Inputs	O
other	O
than	O
quoted	O
prices	O
included	O
within	O
Level	O
1	O
that	O
are	O
observable	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
either	O
directly	O
or	O
indirectly	O
Level	O
3	O
:	O
Unobservable	O
inputs	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
Level	O
1	O
$	O
Level	O
2	O
$	O
Level	O
3	O
$	O
Total	O
$	O
Consolidated	O
-	O

2016	O
Assets	O
Ordinary	O
shares	O
188	O
,	O
617	O
-	O

-	O

188	O
,	O
617	O
Total	O
assets	O
188	O
,	O
617	O
-	O

-	O

188	O
,	O
617	O
Consolidated	O
-	O

2015	O
Assets	O
Ordinary	O
shares	O
270	O
,	O
680	O
-	O

-	O

270	O
,	O
680	O
Total	O
assets	O
270	O
,	O
680	O
-	O

-	O

270	O
,	O
680	O
Assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
held	O
for	O
sale	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
on	O
a	O
non-recurring	O
basis.	O
There	O
were	O
no	O
transfers	O
between	O
levels	O
during	O
the	O
financial	O
year.	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
When	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
financial	O
or	O
non-financial	O
,	O
is	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
for	O
recognition	O
or	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
,	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
price	O
that	O
would	O
be	O
received	O
to	O
sell	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
paid	O
to	O
transfer	O
a	O
liability	O
in	O
an	O
orderly	O
transaction	O
between	O
market	O
participants	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date	O
;	O
and	O
assumes	O
that	O
the	O
transaction	O
will	O
take	O
place	O
either	O
:	O
in	O
the	O
principal	O
market	O
;	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
absence	O
of	O
a	O
principal	O
market	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
most	O
advantageous	O
market.	O
Fair	O
value	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
the	O
assumptions	O
that	O
market	O
participants	O
would	O
use	O
when	O
pricing	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
assuming	O
they	O
act	O
in	O
their	O
economic	O
best	O
interests.	O
Valuation	O
techniques	O
that	O
are	O
appropriate	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
sufficient	O
data	O
are	O
available	O
to	O
measure	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
are	O
used	O
,	O
maximising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
relevant	O
observable	O
inputs	O
and	O
minimising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
unobservable	O
inputs.	O
Assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
are	O
classified	O
,	O
into	O
three	O
levels	O
,	O
using	O
a	O
fair	O
value	O
hierarchy	O
that	O
reflects	O
the	O
significance	O
of	O
the	O
inputs	O
used	O
in	O
making	O
the	O
measurements.	O
Classifications	O
are	O
reviewed	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
transfers	O
between	O
levels	O
are	O
determined	O
based	O
on	O
a	O
reassessment	O
of	O
the	O
lowest	O
level	O
of	O
input	O
that	O
is	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement.	O
38	O

About	O
the	O
Ord	O
Basin	O
Project	O
The	O
Ord	O
Basin	O
Project	O
comprises	O
a	O
1	O
,	O
305	O
km2	O
tenement	O
package	O
located	O
~	O
140	O
km	O
south	O
of	O
Kununurra.	O
Access	O
is	O
via	O
the	O
unsealed	O
Duncan	O
Road	O
and	O
to	O
the	O
west	O
,	O
the	O
Great	O
Northern	O
Highway	O
is	O
a	O
major	O
arterial	O
road	O
that	O
services	O
numerous	O
mining	O
operations	O
in	O
the	O
Kimberley	O
region.	O
The	O
Ord	O
Basin	O
Project	O
is	O
situated	O
in	O
a	O
rapidly	O
emerging	O
district	O
prospective	O
for	O
Michigan-style	O
stratigraphic	O
copper	O
and	O
Norilsk-style	O
nickel	O
copper-PGE	O
mineral	O
systems.	O
At	O
the	O
Caves	O
Prospect	O
,	O
historical	O
mapping	O
and	O
sampling	O
completed	O
in	O
1969	O
identified	O
outcropping	O
mineralisation	O
over	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
approximately	O
90m	O
x	O
180m	O
before	O
dipping	O
under	O
cover.	O
-	O

END	O
-	O

ABOUT	O
OMNIA	O
Omnia	O
Metals	O
Group	O
Ltd	O
(	O
ASX	O
:	O
OM1	O
)	O
is	O
focussed	O
on	O
exploring	O
for	O
future	O
facing	O
commodities	O
used	O
in	O
advanced	O
technologies	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
focus	O
on	O
nickel	O
,	O
copper	O
and	O
platinum	O
group	O
elements.	O
Omnia	O
’	O
s	O
primary	O
focus	O
is	O
1	O
,	O
305km2	O
of	O
tenure	O
in	O
the	O
highly	O
Ord	O
Basin	O
Project	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
situated	O
in	O
a	O
rapidly	O
emerging	O
district	O
prospective	O
for	O
Norilsk-style	O
nickel-copper-PGE	O
and	O
stratigraphic	O
copper	O
mineral	O
systems.	O
Historical	O
exploration	O
has	O
been	O
limited	O
in	O
the	O
region	O
,	O
as	O
such	O
the	O
Ord	O
Basin	O
Project	O
represents	O
a	O
district	O
scale	O
,	O
greenfields	O
exploration	O
opportunity.	O
Omnia	O
’	O
s	O
exploration	O
strategy	O
is	O
to	O
complete	O
high-powered	O
electromagnetic	O
and	O
ground	O
gravity	O
geophysical	O
surveys	O
,	O
which	O
will	O
be	O
complimented	O
by	O
regional	O
geochemical	O
sampling	O
,	O
to	O
delineate	O
high-priority	O
drill	O
targets.	O

initial	O
geophysical	O
and	O
geochemical	O
surveys	O
,	O
Omnia	O
plans	O
to	O
complete	O
its	O

campaign	O

ZINC	O
EQUIVALENT	O
GRADES	O
2	O
5	O
On	O
19	O
April	O
2022	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
released	O
assay	O
results	O
showing	O
individual	O
grades	O
of	O
Zn/Pb/Ag/V	O
O	O
/Ga/Ge	O
2	O
5	O
from	O
seven	O
holes	O
drilled	O
into	O
the	O
totally	O
oxidised	O
polymetallic	O
Nxuu	O
Deposit.	O
Since	O
that	O
release	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
has	O
received	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
queries	O
with	O
regard	O
to	O
the	O
potential	O
contribution	O
each	O
of	O
the	O
individual	O
metals	O
could	O
make	O
to	O
the	O
project.	O
Calculation	O
of	O
Zinc	O
Equivalent	O
Grades	O
In	O
an	O
attempt	O
to	O
clarify	O
the	O
situation	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
has	O
compiled	O
data	O
from	O
the	O
seven	O
drill	O
holes	O
which	O
shows	O
a	O
Zinc	O
equivalent	O
grade	O
for	O
all	O
six	O
minerals.	O
The	O
Zinc	O
equivalent	O
grade	O
has	O
been	O
calculated	O
as	O
Zinc	O
is	O
the	O
primary	O
metal	O
in	O
the	O
totally	O
oxidised	O
polymetallic	O
Nxuu	O
Deposit.	O
At	O
this	O
stage	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
has	O
also	O
compiled	O
Zinc	O
equivalent	O
grades	O
for	O
four	O
holes	O
(	O
shown	O
as	O
NBR	O
)	O
neighbouring	O
the	O
seven	O
drill	O
holes	O
,	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
include	O
extensions	O
of	O
mineralisation.	O
The	O
intention	O
is	O
to	O
calculate	O
Zinc	O
equivalent	O
grades	O
for	O
all	O
holes	O
assayed	O
for	O
all	O
six	O
minerals	O
,	O
whereupon	O
further	O
information	O
will	O
be	O
released	O
to	O
the	O
market.	O

holes	O
drilled	O
to	O
date	O
into	O

for	O

21MRRC045	O

Reward	O
NSR	O
Note	O
:	O
NSR	O
-	O

no	O
significant	O
result	O
Calculated	O
at	O
a	O
0.5g/t	O
cut-off	O

than	O

APPENDIX	O
2	O
JORC	O
Code	O
,	O
2012	O
Edition	O
–	O

Table	O
1	O
Section	O
1	O
Sampling	O
Techniques	O
and	O
Data	O
Criteria	O
Commentary	O
Sampling	O
techniques	O
•	O

The	O
sampling	O
has	O
been	O
carried	O
out	O
using	O
Reverse	O
Circulation	O
drilling	O
(	O
RC	O
)	O
.	O

A	O
total	O
of	O
45	O
holes	O
(	O
21MRRC001-045	O
)	O
were	O
drilled	O
in	O
the	O
reported	O
program	O
for	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
4	O
,	O
300m	O
at	O
depths	O
ranging	O
from	O
54	O
to	O
200m	O
•	O

Ozz	O
Resources	O
LTD	O
(	O
OZZ	O
)	O
sampling	O
is	O
conducted	O
using	O
standard	O
industry	O
practices	O
including	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
duplicates	O
,	O
blanks	O
and	O
standards	O
at	O
regular	O
intervals.	O
The	O
performance	O
of	O
QAQC	O
controls	O
is	O
monitored	O
on	O
a	O
batch-by-batch	O
basis.	O
•	O

All	O
sampling	O
and	O
data	O
collection	O
is	O
supervised	O
by	O
a	O
qualified	O
geologist.	O
•	O

RC	O
holes	O
were	O
drilled	O
with	O
a	O
5.25-inch	O
face-sampling	O
bit	O
,	O
with	O
1m	O
samples	O
collected	O
through	O
a	O
cyclone	O
and	O
cone	O
splitter	O
,	O
to	O
result	O
in	O
a	O
2-3kg	O
and	O
a	O
bulk	O
25-40kg	O
sample	O
per	O
metre.	O
The	O
2-3	O
kg	O
samples	O
were	O
dispatched	O
to	O
SGS	O
laboratories	O
in	O
Perth.	O
These	O
samples	O
were	O
sorted	O
and	O

by	O

assay	O
laboratory	O
,	O

to	O

a	O

Assay/AAS.	O
Drilling	O
techniques	O
•	O

was	O

RC	O

Drill	O
sample	O
recovery	O
•	O

Sample	O
weights	O
,	O
dryness	O
and	O
recoveries	O
are	O
observed	O
and	O
recorded	O
with	O
sample	O
data	O
by	O
the	O
supervising	O
geologists.	O
•	O

Samples	O
were	O
weighed	O
at	O
the	O
laboratory	O
to	O
allow	O
comparative	O
analysis	O
between	O
submitted	O
sample	O
weight	O
and	O
grade.	O
•	O

OZZ	O
contracted	O
drillers	O
use	O
industry	O
appropriate	O
methods	O
to	O
maximise	O
sample	O
recovery	O
and	O
minimise	O
downhole	O
contamination.	O
•	O

No	O
significant	O
sample	O
grade	O
bias	O
associated	O
with	O
sample	O
recovery	O
has	O
been	O
noted	O
in	O
previous	O
drilling	O
or	O
in	O

conducted	O
by	O
OZZ.	O
Logging	O
•	O

All	O
holes	O
were	O
logged	O
in	O
full	O
by	O
qualified	O
OZZ	O
staff	O
geologists	O
in	O
line	O
with	O
industry	O
standards	O
and	O
the	O
OZZ	O
logging	O
scheme.	O
•	O

Logging	O
of	O
RC	O
chips	O
records	O
including	O
lithology	O
,	O
mineralogy	O
,	O
mineralisation	O
,	O
weathering	O
,	O
colour	O
and	O
other	O
features	O
of	O
the	O
samples.	O
All	O
samples	O
are	O
wet-sieved	O
and	O
stored	O
in	O
chip	O
trays.	O
These	O
trays	O
were	O
stored	O
off	O
site	O
for	O
future	O
reference.	O

techniques	O
and	O
sample	O
•	O

and	O

a	O

laboratory	O
(	O
SGS	O
Laboratories	O
)	O
.	O

preparation	O

by	O
dry	O

to	O
85%	O
passing	O
75	O
microns	O
is	O

with	O
pass	O
rates	O
recorded	O
at	O
regular	O
intervals	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
labs	O
reporting	O
process.	O

rates	O
are	O
monitored	O
on	O
a	O
batch-by-batch	O
basis	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
QAQC	O
conventions.	O
•	O

weights	O
,	O

and	O

onsite	O

a	O

of	O
1	O
:	O
40	O
samples.	O
•	O

and	O

are	O

for	O
the	O

and	O

Au	O
analysis	O
was	O
undertaken	O
by	O
SGS	O
Laboratories	O
(	O
a	O
registered	O
laboratory	O
)	O
,	O
with	O
50g	O
fire	O
assay	O
and	O
MP-AES	O
finish.	O
This	O
method	O
has	O
a	O
detection	O
limit	O
of	O
0.01ppm.	O
•	O

Internal	O
certified	O
laboratory	O
QAQC	O
is	O
undertaken	O
as	O
is	O
industry	O
standard	O
;	O
including	O
check	O
samples	O
,	O

,	O
blanks	O
,	O
and	O
internal	O
standards.	O
•	O

refire	O

own	O
check	O

within	O
each	O
submission	O
(	O
as	O
is	O
industry	O
standard	O
)	O
;	O
including	O
repeats	O
,	O
blanks	O
,	O
and	O
internal	O

•	O

collated	O

of	O
templates.	O
Geological	O
for	O
all	O
sampling	O
data	O

before	O
loading	O
into	O
a	O
database.	O
Geological	O
logging	O
of	O
all	O
samples	O
/	O
intervals	O
is	O

in	O
the	O

a	O

•	O

data	O

or	O

always	O

of	O

points	O

All	O
historical	O
drillholes	O
have	O
intersected	O
moderate	O
to	O
high	O
mylonised	O
phyllite/metasediments.	O
Visible	O
gold	O
recorded	O
is	O
associated	O
with	O
arsenopyrite	O
and	O
euhedral	O
pyrite	O
and	O
contained	O
within	O
a	O
carbonate-quartz-sericite-biotite	O
mylonite	O
proximal	O
to	O
stockworked	O
carbonate-quartz	O
veining.	O
-	O

Arsenic	O
levels	O
are	O
high	O
in	O
the	O
region	O
on	O
the	O
whole.	O
-	O

The	O
top	O
of	O
fresh	O
rock	O
ranges	O
from	O
between	O
85	O
and	O
125m.	O
-	O

Gold	O
mineralisation	O
relates	O
to	O
carbonate-quartz	O
stockworks	O
and	O
veins	O
hosted	O
by	O
a	O
sheared	O
,	O
carbonate	O
flooded	O
,	O
mafic-ultramafic	O
volcanic	O
succession.	O
-	O

There	O
is	O
very	O
obviously	O
carbonate	O
rich	O
fluid	O
flows	O
and	O
an	O
accumulation	O
of	O
transitional	O
ductile-brittle	O
structural	O
regimes	O
witnessed	O
through	O
the	O
limited	O
drilling	O
to	O
date.	O
Drill	O
hole	O
Information	O
•	O

Refer	O
to	O
the	O
table	O
in	O
the	O
body	O
of	O
the	O
text.	O
•	O

laid	O
out	O
using	O
a	O

GPS	O
with	O

of	O
+/-	O
5.0m	O
or	O
better	O
for	O
all	O
easting	O
and	O
northing	O
data.	O

drillhole	O
collars	O
are	O

by	O
DGPS	O
to	O
a	O
precision	O
of	O
0.05m.	O
•	O

data	O
is	O

to	O
<1m.	O
All	O
collar	O
coordinates	O
are	O
referenced	O
against	O
the	O
project	O
DTM.	O
A	O
DTM	O
has	O
been	O
created	O
for	O
the	O
tenements	O
incorporating	O
all	O
available	O
and	O
viable	O
DGPS	O
points	O
–	O

including	O
tenement	O
walk-overs.	O
•	O

Grades	O
are	O
reported	O
as	O
down-hole	O
length-weighted	O
averages	O
of	O
grades.	O
No	O
top	O
cuts	O
have	O
been	O
applied	O
to	O
the	O
reporting	O
of	O
the	O
assay	O
results.	O
•	O

All	O
higher-grade	O
intervals	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
reported	O
grade	O
intervals.	O
•	O

All	O
location	O
and	O
orientation	O
data	O
is	O
included	O
within	O
the	O
main	O
body	O
of	O
this	O
report.	O
Data	O
aggregation	O
methods	O
•	O

All	O
reported	O
RC	O
assay	O
results	O
have	O
been	O
length	O
weighted	O
(	O
arithmetic	O
length	O
weighting	O
)	O
.	O

•	O

For	O
all	O
OZZ	O
sampling	O
results	O
,	O
unaltered	O
results	O
are	O
presented	O
,	O
no	O
averaging	O
,	O
or	O
top-cuts	O
have	O
been	O
applied.	O
•	O

No	O
metal	O
equivalent	O
values	O
are	O
used	O
for	O
reporting	O
exploration	O
results.	O
Relationship	O
between	O
mineralisation	O
•	O

Drilling	O
completed	O
perpendicular	O
to	O
strike	O
of	O
the	O
mineralisation.	O
widths	O
and	O
intercept	O
lengths	O
•	O

All	O
drillhole	O
intercepts	O
are	O
measured	O
in	O
downhole	O
metres	O
,	O
with	O
true	O
widths	O
estimated	O
to	O
be	O
about	O
60%	O
of	O
the	O
down-hole	O
width.	O
•	O

Due	O
to	O
the	O
low	O
amount	O
of	O
drilling	O
,	O
the	O
orientation	O
of	O
the	O
drilling	O
has	O
the	O
potential	O
to	O
introduce	O
some	O
sampling	O
bias	O
(	O
positive	O
or	O
negative	O
)	O
Diagrams	O
•	O

Refer	O
to	O
Figures	O
and	O
Tables	O
within	O
the	O
body	O
of	O
the	O
text.	O
Balanced	O
reporting	O
•	O

All	O
significant	O
assays	O
intervals	O
tabulated	O
using	O
a	O
0.5g/t	O
cut-off	O
with	O
a	O
maximum	O
of	O
2m	O
of	O
internal	O
waste	O
•	O

Balanced	O
reporting	O
has	O
been	O
applied	O
Other	O
substantive	O
exploration	O
data	O
•	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
other	O
substantive	O
exploration	O
data.	O
•	O

Refer	O
to	O
body	O
of	O
text	O
and	O
this	O
appendix.	O
Further	O
work	O
•	O

Although	O
not	O
yet	O
planned	O
by	O
OZZ	O
in	O
detail	O
,	O

is	O

further	O
work	O
will	O
include	O
infill	O
and	O
step	O
out	O
drilling.	O

to	O

in	O
and	O

potential	O
extensions	O
to	O
the	O
current	O
mineralisation.	O

ended	O
30	O
June	O

my	O
first	O
as	O
Oklo	O
’	O

Chairman	O

in	O

has	O
seen	O
Oklo	O

a	O

a	O

gold	O
company	O
in	O
Mali	O

managed	O
by	O

with	O
a	O
proven	O
track	O
record	O
of	O
large	O
gold	O
discoveries	O
in	O
West	O
Africa.	O
Oklo	O
has	O
assembled	O
a	O
large	O
landholding	O
covering	O
more	O
than	O
1	O
,	O
300km2	O
in	O
Mali	O
’	O
s	O
prolific	O
gold	O
belts	O
,	O
which	O
are	O
host	O
to	O
world-class	O
,	O
multi-million-ounce	O
gold	O
mines.	O
During	O
the	O
reporting	O
year	O
we	O
embarked	O
on	O
an	O
aggressive	O
exploration	O
program	O
and	O
to	O

some	O

results	O

from	O
the	O

at	O

Dandoko	O

and	O

has	O

of	O
an	O

at	O

of	O

in	O

of	O
bedrock	O
gold	O
mineralisation.	O

,	O

’	O
s	O
5.15Moz	O
Fekola	O

Oklo	O
’	O
s	O

1	O
)	O
.	O

1	O

its	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O

5	O
2016	O
Annual	O
Report	O
OPERATIONS	O
REVIEW	O
DANDOKO	O
PROJECT	O
–	O

West	O
Mali	O
(	O
100%	O
interest	O
)	O
The	O
Dandoko	O
permit	O
(	O
134km2	O
)	O
is	O
located	O
within	O
the	O
Kenieba	O
Inlier	O
of	O
western	O
Mali	O
close	O
to	O
several	O
world-class	O
gold	O
deposits	O
,	O
including	O
B2Gold	O
’	O
s	O
5.15Moz	O
Fekola	O
gold	O
project	O
30km	O
to	O
the	O
west	O
and	O
Randgold	O
’	O
s	O
12.5Moz	O
Loulo	O
Gold	O
Mine	O
,	O
50km	O
to	O
the	O
north-northwest	O
(	O
Figure	O
2	O
)	O
.	O

Access	O
from	O
the	O
capital	O
city	O
of	O
Bamako	O
is	O
via	O
a	O
high	O
quality	O
sealed	O
road	O
,	O
which	O
passes	O
through	O
the	O
northern	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
project.	O
The	O
tenement	O
is	O
underlain	O
by	O
a	O
Lower	O
Proterozoic	O
Birimian	O
meta-volcanic	O
and	O
meta-sedimentary	O
sequence.	O
A	O
series	O
of	O
dominant	O
NNE-trending	O
faults	O
,	O
displaced	O
by	O
a	O
second	O
set	O
of	O
ESE-trending	O
faults	O
,	O
have	O
been	O
mapped	O
or	O
interpreted	O
from	O
aeromagnetic	O
data.	O
The	O
NNE-trending	O
structures	O
are	O
interpreted	O
as	O
splays	O
emanating	O
from	O
the	O
Senegal	O
Mali	O
Shear	O
Zone	O
(	O
“	O
SMSZ	O
”	O
)	O
,	O
a	O
regional	O
scale	O
NNW-	O
trending	O
strike-slip	O
fault	O
,	O
which	O
plays	O
an	O
important	O
role	O
in	O
controlling	O
gold	O
mineralisation	O
in	O
the	O
region.	O
The	O
SMSZ	O
hosts	O
no	O
fewer	O
than	O
six	O
major	O
gold	O
deposits	O
for	O
an	O
endowment	O
estimated	O
at	O
greater	O
than	O
40Moz	O
,	O
including	O
Sadiola	O
(	O
13.5Moz	O
)	O
and	O
Loulo	O
(	O
12.5Moz	O
)	O
.	O

Oklo	O
therefore	O
considers	O
the	O
Dandoko	O
Project	O
to	O
be	O
highly	O
prospective	O
for	O
the	O
discovery	O
of	O
significant	O
gold	O
deposits	O
and	O
places	O
particular	O
emphasis	O
on	O
the	O
importance	O
of	O
NNE-trending	O
faults	O
as	O
mineralising	O
conduits.	O
Figure	O
2	O
:	O
Location	O
and	O

INDEMNIFICATION	O
OF	O
DIRECTORS	O
AND	O
OFFICERS	O
During	O
the	O
year	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
paid	O
an	O
insurance	O
premium	O
to	O
insure	O
certain	O
directors	O
and	O
officers	O
including	O
Directors	O
named	O
in	O
this	O
report.	O
The	O
Directors	O
and	O
Officers	O
Liability	O
insurance	O
provides	O
cover	O
against	O
all	O
costs	O
and	O
expenses	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
incurred	O
in	O
defending	O
civil	O
or	O
criminal	O
proceedings	O
that	O
fall	O
within	O
the	O
scope	O
of	O
the	O
indemnity	O
and	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
brought	O
against	O
the	O
officers	O
in	O
their	O
capacity	O
as	O
officers	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O
The	O
insurance	O
policy	O
does	O
not	O
contain	O
details	O
of	O
the	O
premium	O
paid	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
individual	O
officers	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O
Disclosure	O
of	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
liability	O
cover	O
and	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
premium	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
a	O
confidentiality	O
clause	O
under	O
the	O
insurance	O
policy.	O
The	O
Company	O
has	O
not	O
provided	O
any	O
insurance	O
for	O
an	O
auditor	O
of	O
the	O
group.	O
ENVIRONMENTAL	O
REGULATION	O
The	O
Group	O
is	O
aware	O
of	O
its	O
environmental	O
obligations	O
and	O
acts	O
to	O
ensure	O
that	O
its	O
environmental	O
commitments	O
are	O
met.	O
The	O
Group	O
is	O
not	O
currently	O
subject	O
to	O
significant	O
environmental	O
regulation	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
its	O
activities.	O
The	O
Directors	O
have	O
considered	O
compliance	O
with	O
the	O
National	O
Greenhouse	O
and	O
Energy	O
Reporting	O
Act	O
2007	O
which	O
requires	O
entities	O
to	O
report	O
annual	O
greenhouse	O
gas	O
emissions	O
and	O
energy	O
use.	O
For	O
the	O
measurement	O
period	O
from	O
1	O
July	O
2015	O
to	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
the	O
Directors	O
have	O
assessed	O
that	O
the	O
Company	O
has	O
no	O
current	O
reporting	O
requirements	O
,	O

)	O

(	O

)	O

report	O

and	O

of	O

of	O

of	O

directly	O
or	O

,	O
including	O
any	O

(	O

of	O
the	O

REMUNERATION	O
REPORT	O
(	O
Audited	O
)	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
Remuneration	O
Policy	O
The	O
nature	O
and	O
amount	O
of	O
remuneration	O
for	O
the	O
Non-executive	O
Directors	O
and	O
executives	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
role	O
and	O
market	O
rates	O
for	O
the	O
position	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
assistance	O
of	O
external	O
surveys	O
and	O
reports	O
,	O
taking	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
experience	O
and	O
qualifications	O
of	O
each	O
individual.	O
The	O
Board	O
ensures	O
that	O
the	O
remuneration	O
of	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
is	O
competitive	O
and	O
reasonable.	O
Fees	O
and	O
payments	O
to	O
the	O
Non-	O
executive	O
Directors	O
reflect	O
the	O
demands	O
which	O
are	O
made	O
on	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
responsibilities	O
of	O
the	O
Directors.	O
Non-	O
executive	O
Director	O
’	O
s	O
fees	O
and	O
payments	O
are	O
reviewed	O
annually	O
by	O
the	O
Board.	O
In	O
undertaking	O
a	O
review	O
of	O
the	O
performance	O
of	O
both	O
directors	O
and	O
executives	O
,	O
consideration	O
is	O
given	O
to	O
the	O
respective	O
performance	O
of	O
person	O
during	O
the	O
review	O
period	O
;	O
however	O
,	O
there	O
are	O
no	O
prescribed	O
performance	O
measures	O
or	O
hurdles	O
connected	O
with	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
remuneration.	O
Given	O
the	O
current	O
size	O
,	O
nature	O
and	O
risks	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
,	O
incentive	O
options	O
have	O
been	O
used	O
to	O
attract	O
and	O
retain	O
Non-executive	O
Directors	O
and	O
executives.	O
The	O
grant	O
of	O
such	O
options	O
is	O
at	O
the	O
discretion	O
of	O
the	O
Board	O
and	O
subject	O
,	O
as	O
appropriate	O
,	O
to	O
shareholder	O
approval.	O
The	O
Board	O
believes	O
participation	O
in	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
Incentive	O
Option	O
Scheme	O
motivates	O
key	O
management	O
and	O
executives	O
with	O
the	O
long	O
term	O
interests	O
of	O
shareholders.	O
The	O
group	O
has	O
not	O
engaged	O
the	O
services	O
of	O
external	O
remuneration	O
consultants	O
to	O
advise	O
them	O
on	O
Director	O
and	O
executive	O
remuneration	O
policy.	O
At	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
2015	O
Annual	O
General	O
Meeting	O
,	O
the	O
Remuneration	O
Report	O
was	O
passed	O
by	O
way	O
of	O
show	O
of	O
hands	O
and	O
no	O
comment	O
was	O
made	O
on	O
this	O
matter	O
by	O
any	O
attendees.	O

of	O
Directors	O
and	O

Pty	O
Ltd	O

$20	O
,	O
000	O
per	O
month	O
for	O
Mr	O
Taylor	O
in	O
his	O
role	O
as	O
Managing	O
Director.	O
See	O
above	O
for	O
details.	O
On	O
15	O
June	O
2016	O

Company	O
and	O
Geeland	O
Pty	O
Ltd	O

a	O

of	O
services	O
by	O
Mr	O
Simon	O
Taylor	O
as	O
Managing	O
Director	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
(	O
“	O
MD	O
Agreement	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
MD	O
Agreement	O
has	O
an	O
effective	O
date	O
of	O
1	O
July	O
2016	O
and	O
a	O
three	O
(	O
3	O
)	O
year	O
term	O
,	O
which	O
auto	O
renews	O
for	O
successive	O
12	O
month	O
periods.	O
The	O
MD	O
Agreement	O
provides	O
for	O
a	O
monthly	O
retainer	O
of	O
$23	O
,	O
000	O
and	O
this	O
issue	O
of	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
3	O
,	O
000	O
,	O
000	O
incentive	O
options.	O
These	O
options	O
were	O
issued	O
in	O
August	O
2016.	O
The	O
MD	O
Agreement	O
can	O
be	O
terminated	O
with	O
either	O
party	O
giving	O
four	O
(	O
4	O
)	O
months	O
’	O
notice	O
or	O
on	O
a	O
change	O
of	O
control	O
event.	O
If	O
a	O
change	O
of	O
control	O
event	O
occurs	O
,	O
the	O
MD	O
Agreement	O
provides	O
that	O
any	O
unvested	O
options	O
will	O
immediately	O
vest	O
,	O
and	O
for	O
the	O
payment	O
of	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
twelve	O
(	O
12	O
)	O
months	O
’	O
severance	O
pay	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
the	O
change	O
of	O
control	O
event.	O
Remuneration	O
of	O
Key	O
Management	O
Personnel	O

$0.22	O
1	O
,	O

,	O
000	O
$90	O
,	O
010	O
2016	O
2016	O
2019	O
At	O
a	O
meeting	O
of	O

of	O
the	O
Company	O

on	O

April	O

of	O
1	O
,	O

,	O

’	O

a	O

price	O
of	O
$0.22	O
with	O
an	O
expiry	O
date	O
of	O
3	O
years	O
after	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
issue	O
(	O
28	O
April	O
2016	O
)	O
The	O
grant	O
of	O
options	O
to	O
Mr	O
O	O
’	O
Loughlin	O
,	O
a	O
Non-Executive	O
Director	O
was	O
not	O
linked	O
to	O
performance	O
;	O
however	O
,	O
the	O
Board	O
considered	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
the	O
options	O
to	O
be	O
reasonable	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
given	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
size	O
,	O
stage	O
of	O
development	O
and	O
need	O
to	O
attract	O
directors	O
and	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
of	O
a	O
high	O
calibre	O
while	O
still	O
maintaining	O
cash	O
reserves.	O
Options	O
granted	O
carry	O
no	O
dividend	O
or	O
voting	O
rights.	O
When	O
exercisable	O
,	O
each	O
option	O
is	O
convertible	O
into	O
one	O
ordinary	O
share.	O
The	O
assessed	O
fair	O
value	O
at	O
grant	O
date	O
of	O
options	O
granted	O
to	O
the	O
individuals	O
is	O
allocated	O
equally	O
over	O
the	O
period	O
from	O
the	O
grant	O
date	O
to	O
vesting	O
date	O
and	O
the	O
amount	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
remuneration	O
tables	O
above.	O
Fair	O
values	O
at	O
grant	O
date	O
are	O
independently	O
determined	O
using	O
a	O
Binomial	O
Methodology	O
option	O
pricing	O
model	O
that	O
takes	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
exercise	O
price	O
,	O
the	O
terms	O
of	O
the	O
option	O
,	O
the	O
impact	O
of	O
dilution	O
,	O
the	O
share	O
price	O
at	O
grant	O
date	O
and	O
expected	O
price	O
volatility	O
of	O
the	O
underlying	O
share	O
,	O
the	O
expected	O
dividend	O
yield	O
and	O
the	O
risk-free	O
rate	O
for	O
the	O
term	O
of	O
the	O
option.	O

model	O
inputs	O
for	O

during	O

year	O

REMUNERATION	O
REPORT	O
(	O
Audited	O
)	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
Securities	O
Trading	O
Policy	O
The	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
security	O
trading	O
policy	O
provides	O
guidance	O
on	O
acceptable	O
transactions	O
in	O
dealing	O
in	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
various	O
securities	O
,	O
including	O
shares	O
,	O
debt	O
notes	O
and	O
options.	O
The	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
security	O
trading	O
policy	O
defines	O
dealing	O
in	O
company	O
securities	O
to	O
include	O
:	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
Subscribing	O
for	O
,	O
purchasing	O
or	O
selling	O
Company	O
Securities	O
or	O
entering	O
into	O
an	O
agreement	O
to	O
do	O
any	O
of	O
those	O
things	O
;	O
(	O
b	O
)	O
Advising	O
,	O
procuring	O
or	O
encouraging	O
another	O
person	O
(	O
including	O
a	O
family	O
member	O
,	O
friend	O
,	O
associate	O
,	O
colleague	O
,	O
family	O
company	O
or	O
family	O
trust	O
)	O
to	O
trade	O
in	O
Company	O
Securities	O
;	O
and	O
(	O
c	O
)	O
Entering	O
into	O
agreements	O
or	O
transactions	O
which	O
operate	O
to	O
limit	O
the	O
economic	O
risk	O
of	O
a	O
person	O
’	O
s	O
holdings	O
in	O
Company	O
Securities.	O
The	O
securities	O
trading	O
policy	O
details	O
acceptable	O
and	O
unacceptable	O
times	O
for	O
trading	O
in	O
Company	O
Securities	O
including	O
detailing	O
potential	O
civil	O
and	O
criminal	O
penalties	O
for	O
misuse	O
of	O
“	O
inside	O
information	O
”	O
.	O

The	O
Directors	O
must	O
not	O
deal	O
in	O
Company	O
Securities	O
without	O
providing	O
written	O
notification	O
to	O
the	O
Chairman.	O
The	O
Chairman	O
must	O
not	O
deal	O
in	O
Company	O
Securities	O
without	O
the	O
prior	O
approval	O
of	O
the	O
Chief	O
Executive	O
Officer.	O
The	O
Directors	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
disclosure	O
to	O
the	O
market	O
of	O
all	O
transactions	O
or	O
contracts	O
involving	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
shares.	O
This	O
is	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O

NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
1.	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
The	O
principal	O
accounting	O
policies	O
adopted	O
in	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
these	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
set	O
out	O
below.	O
These	O
policies	O
have	O
been	O
consistently	O
applied	O
to	O
all	O
the	O
years	O
presented	O
,	O
unless	O
otherwise	O
stated.	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
for	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
consist	O
of	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries.	O
Statement	O
of	O
compliance	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
general	O
purpose	O
financial	O
statements	O
which	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001	O
,	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Interpretations	O
and	O
complies	O
with	O
other	O
requirements	O
of	O
the	O
law.	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
and	O
notes	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
comply	O
with	O
International	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
(	O
‘	O
IFRS	O
’	O
)	O
.	O

Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
is	O
a	O
for-profit	O
entity	O
for	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
were	O
authorised	O
for	O
issue	O
by	O
the	O
Directors	O
on	O
30	O
September	O
2016.	O
Basis	O
of	O
preparation	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
historical	O
cost.	O
Cost	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
fair	O
values	O
of	O
the	O
consideration	O
given	O
in	O
exchange	O
for	O
assets.	O
In	O
the	O
application	O
of	O
IFRS	O
,	O
management	O
is	O
required	O
to	O
make	O
judgments	O
,	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
about	O
carrying	O
values	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
that	O
are	O
not	O
readily	O
apparent	O
from	O
other	O
sources.	O
The	O
estimates	O
and	O
associated	O
assumptions	O
are	O
based	O
on	O
historical	O
experience	O
and	O
various	O
other	O
factors	O
that	O
are	O
believed	O
to	O
be	O
reasonable	O
under	O
the	O
circumstance	O
,	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
which	O
form	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
making	O
the	O
judgments.	O
Actual	O
results	O
may	O
differ	O
from	O
these	O
estimates.	O
The	O
estimates	O
and	O
underlying	O
assumptions	O
are	O
reviewed	O
on	O
an	O
ongoing	O
basis.	O
Revisions	O
to	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
estimate	O
is	O
revised	O
if	O
the	O
revision	O
affects	O
only	O
that	O
period	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
of	O
the	O
revision	O
and	O
future	O
periods	O
if	O
the	O
revision	O
affects	O
both	O
current	O
and	O
future	O
periods.	O
Judgments	O
made	O
by	O
management	O
in	O
the	O
application	O
of	O
IFRS	O
that	O
have	O
significant	O
effects	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
and	O
estimates	O
with	O
a	O
significant	O
risk	O
of	O
material	O
adjustments	O
in	O
the	O
next	O
period	O
are	O
disclosed	O
,	O
where	O
applicable	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
relevant	O
notes	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
New	O
and	O
amended	O
standards	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
group	O
The	O
group	O
has	O
applied	O
the	O
following	O
standards	O
and	O
amendments	O
for	O
the	O
first	O
time	O
for	O
the	O
annual	O
reporting	O
period	O
commencing	O
1	O
July	O
2015	O
:	O
•	O

Interpretation	O
21	O
Accounting	O
for	O
Levies	O
•	O

AASB	O
2013-3	O
Amendments	O
to	O
AASB	O
136	O
–	O

Recoverable	O
Amount	O
Disclosures	O
for	O
Non-	O
Financial	O
Assets	O
•	O

AASB	O
2013-4	O
Amendments	O
to	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
–	O

Novation	O
of	O
Derivatives	O
and	O
Continuation	O
of	O
Hedge	O
Accounting	O
•	O

AASB	O
2015-1	O
Amendments	O
to	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards.	O
The	O
adoption	O
of	O
these	O
standards	O
has	O
not	O
resulted	O
in	O
changes	O
in	O

policies	O
that	O

in	O

to	O

SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
New	O
standards	O
and	O
interpretations	O
not	O
yet	O
adopted	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
and	O
amended	O
pronouncements	O
that	O
are	O
relevant	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
but	O
applicable	O
in	O
future	O
accounting	O
periods	O
is	O
set	O
out	O
below	O
:	O
Standard	O
Title	O
Summary	O
Effective	O
Date	O
AASB	O
9	O
Financial	O
Replaces	O
the	O
requirements	O
of	O
AASB	O
139	O
for	O
the	O
1/1/2018	O
Instruments	O
classification	O
and	O
measurements	O
of	O
financial	O
assets.	O
This	O
is	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
the	O
first	O
part	O
of	O
Phase	O
1	O
of	O
the	O
IASB	O
’	O
s	O
project	O
to	O
replace	O
IAS	O
39.	O
AASB	O
15	O
Revenue	O
The	O
AASB	O
has	O
issued	O
a	O
new	O
standard	O
for	O
the	O
1/1/2018	O
from	O
recognition	O
of	O
revenue.	O
This	O
will	O
replace	O
AASB	O
118	O
Contracts	O
which	O
covers	O
contracts	O
for	O
goods	O
and	O
services	O
and	O
with	O
AASB111	O
which	O
covers	O
construction	O
contracts.	O
Customers	O
The	O
new	O
standard	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
principle	O
that	O
revenue	O
is	O
recognised	O
when	O
control	O
of	O
a	O
good	O
or	O
service	O
transfers	O
to	O
a	O
customer	O
,	O
so	O
the	O
notion	O
of	O
control	O
replaces	O
the	O
existing	O
notion	O
of	O
risks	O
and	O
rewards.	O
The	O
standard	O
permits	O
a	O
modified	O
retrospective	O
approach	O
for	O
the	O
adoption.	O
Under	O
this	O
approach	O
entities	O
will	O
recognise	O
any	O
applicable	O
transitional	O
adjustments	O
in	O
retained	O
earnings	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
the	O
initial	O
application	O
(	O
i.e.	O
1	O
July	O
2017	O
)	O
without	O
restating	O
the	O
comparative	O
period.	O
Entities	O
will	O
only	O
need	O
to	O
apply	O
the	O
new	O
rules	O
to	O
contracts	O
that	O
are	O
not	O
completed	O
as	O
of	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
initial	O
application	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
elected	O
not	O
to	O
early	O
adopt	O
any	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
and	O
amended	O
pronouncements.	O
These	O
are	O
not	O
expected	O
to	O
have	O
significant	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
performance	O
or	O
position	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
upon	O
adoption.	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O

42	O
2016	O
Annual	O
Report	O

TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
1.	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
Significant	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
include	O
:	O
-	O

(	O
i	O
)	O
Impairment	O
of	O
capitalised	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
The	O
future	O
recoverability	O
of	O
capitalised	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
is	O
dependent	O
upon	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
factors	O
including	O
,	O
whether	O
the	O
Company	O
decides	O
to	O
exploit	O
the	O
related	O
lease	O
itself	O
or	O
,	O
if	O
not	O
whether	O
it	O
successfully	O
recovers	O
the	O
related	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
asset	O
through	O
sale.	O
Factors	O
that	O
could	O
impact	O
future	O
recoverability	O
include	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
reserves	O
and	O
resources	O
,	O
future	O
technological	O
changes	O
which	O
could	O
impact	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
mining	O
,	O
future	O
legal	O
changes	O
(	O
including	O
changes	O
to	O
environmental	O
restoration	O
obligations	O
)	O
and	O
changes	O
to	O
commodity	O
prices.	O
To	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
capitalised	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
is	O
determined	O
not	O
to	O
be	O
recoverable	O
in	O
the	O
future	O
,	O
profits	O
and	O
net	O
assets	O
will	O
be	O
reduced	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
determination	O
is	O
made.	O
In	O
addition	O
,	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
is	O
capitalised	O
if	O
activities	O
in	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
have	O
not	O
yet	O
reached	O
a	O
stage	O
that	O
permits	O
a	O
reasonable	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
existence	O
or	O
otherwise	O
of	O
economically	O
recoverable	O
reserves.	O
To	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
determined	O
in	O
the	O
future	O
that	O
this	O
capitalised	O
expenditure	O
should	O
be	O
written	O
off	O
,	O
profits	O
and	O
net	O
assets	O
will	O
be	O
reduced	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
to	O
which	O
the	O
determination	O
is	O
made.	O
(	O
ii	O
)	O
Share-based	O
payments	O
The	O
Company	O
measures	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
equity-settled	O
share-based	O
payment	O
transactions	O
with	O
employees	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
equity	O
instruments	O
at	O
the	O
grant	O
date.	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
determined	O
by	O
using	O
a	O
valuation	O
model	O
,	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
which	O
is	O
set	O
out	O
in	O
note	O
23.	O
The	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
relating	O
to	O
equity-settled	O
share-based	O
payments	O
would	O
have	O
no	O
impact	O
on	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
within	O
the	O
next	O
annual	O
reporting	O
period	O
but	O
may	O
impact	O
expenses	O
and	O
equity.	O
Accounting	O
policies	O
are	O
selected	O
and	O
applied	O
in	O
a	O
manner	O
which	O
ensures	O
that	O
the	O
resulting	O
financial	O
information	O
satisfies	O
the	O
concepts	O
of	O
relevance	O
and	O
reliability	O
,	O
thereby	O
ensuring	O
that	O
the	O
substance	O
of	O
the	O
underlying	O
transactions	O
or	O
other	O
events	O
is	O
reported.	O
The	O
accounting	O
policies	O
set	O
out	O
below	O
have	O
been	O
applied	O
in	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2016.	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
Principles	O
of	O
consolidation	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
incorporate	O
the	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
of	O
all	O
subsidiaries	O
of	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
(	O
'company'	O
or	O
'parent	O
entity'	O
)	O
as	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
and	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
all	O
subsidiaries	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
then	O
ended.	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
together	O
are	O
referred	O
to	O
in	O
these	O
financial	O
statements	O
as	O
the	O
'consolidated	O
entity'.	O
Subsidiaries	O
are	O
all	O
those	O
entities	O
over	O
which	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
control.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
controls	O
an	O
entity	O
when	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
,	O
or	O
has	O
rights	O
to	O
,	O
variable	O
returns	O
from	O
its	O
involvement	O
with	O
the	O
entity	O
and	O
has	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
affect	O
those	O
returns	O
through	O
its	O
power	O
to	O
direct	O
the	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
entity.	O
Subsidiaries	O
are	O
fully	O
consolidated	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
on	O
which	O
control	O
is	O
transferred	O
to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
They	O
are	O
de-consolidated	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
control	O
ceases.	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O
Page	O
43	O
2016	O
Annual	O
Report	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
1.	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
Intercompany	O
transactions	O
,	O
balances	O
and	O
unrealised	O
gains	O
on	O
transactions	O
between	O
entities	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
are	O
eliminated.	O
Unrealised	O
losses	O
are	O
also	O
eliminated	O
unless	O
the	O
transaction	O
provides	O
evidence	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
transferred.	O
Accounting	O
policies	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
have	O
been	O
changed	O
where	O
necessary	O
to	O
ensure	O
consistency	O
with	O
the	O
policies	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
The	O
acquisition	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
is	O
accounted	O
for	O
using	O
the	O
acquisition	O
method	O
of	O
accounting.	O
A	O
change	O
in	O
ownership	O
interest	O
,	O
without	O
the	O
loss	O
of	O
control	O
,	O
is	O
accounted	O
for	O
as	O
an	O
equity	O
transaction	O
,	O
where	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
consideration	O
transferred	O
and	O
the	O
book	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
share	O
of	O
the	O
non-controlling	O
interest	O
acquired	O
is	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
parent.	O
Non-controlling	O
interest	O
in	O
the	O
results	O
and	O
equity	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
are	O
shown	O
separately	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
,	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
and	O
statement	O
of	O
changes	O
in	O
equity	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
Losses	O
incurred	O
by	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
are	O
attributed	O
to	O
the	O
non-controlling	O
interest	O
in	O
full	O
,	O
even	O
if	O
that	O
results	O
in	O
a	O
deficit	O
balance.	O
Where	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
loses	O
control	O
over	O
a	O
subsidiary	O
,	O
it	O
derecognises	O
the	O
assets	O
including	O
goodwill	O
,	O
liabilities	O
and	O
non-controlling	O
interest	O
in	O
the	O
subsidiary	O
together	O
with	O
any	O
cumulative	O
translation	O
differences	O
recognised	O
in	O
equity.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
recognises	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
consideration	O
received	O
and	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
any	O
investment	O
retained	O
together	O
with	O
any	O
gain	O
or	O
loss	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
(	O
b	O
)	O
Segment	O
reporting	O
Operating	O
segments	O
are	O
reported	O
in	O
a	O
manner	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
internal	O
reporting	O
provided	O
to	O
the	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker.	O
The	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker	O
who	O
is	O
responsible	O
for	O
allocating	O
resources	O
and	O
assessing	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
operating	O
segments	O
,	O
has	O
been	O
identified	O
as	O
the	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
of	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited.	O
(	O
c	O
)	O
Cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
For	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
,	O
cash	O
includes	O
cash	O
on	O
hand	O
and	O
in	O
banks	O
and	O
at	O
call	O
deposits	O
with	O
banks	O
or	O
financial	O
institutions.	O
(	O
d	O
)	O
Financial	O
instruments	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
Company	O
Debt	O
and	O
equity	O
instruments	O
Debt	O
and	O
equity	O
instruments	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
either	O
liabilities	O
or	O
as	O
equity	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
substance	O
of	O
the	O
contractual	O
arrangement.	O
Transaction	O
costs	O
on	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
equity	O
instruments	O
Transaction	O
costs	O
arising	O
on	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
equity	O
instruments	O
are	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity	O
as	O
a	O
reduction	O
of	O
the	O
proceeds	O
of	O
the	O
equity	O
instruments	O
to	O
which	O
the	O
costs	O
relate.	O
Transaction	O
costs	O
are	O
the	O
costs	O
that	O
are	O
incurred	O
directly	O
in	O
connection	O
with	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
those	O
equity	O
instruments	O
and	O
which	O
would	O
not	O
have	O
been	O
incurred	O
had	O
those	O
instruments	O
not	O
been	O
issued.	O
Interest	O
and	O
dividends	O
Interest	O
and	O
dividends	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
expenses	O
or	O
as	O
distributions	O
of	O
profit	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
statement	O

related	O

SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
(	O
e	O
)	O
Derivative	O
Financial	O
Instruments	O
The	O
Group	O
enters	O
into	O
derivative	O
financial	O
instruments	O
to	O
manage	O
its	O
exposure	O
to	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
rate	O
risk	O
,	O
including	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
forward	O
contracts.	O
Further	O
details	O
of	O
derivative	O
financial	O
instruments	O
are	O
disclosed	O
in	O
note	O
18.	O
Derivatives	O
are	O
initially	O
recognised	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
the	O
derivative	O
contract	O
is	O
entered	O
into	O
and	O
are	O
subsequently	O
remeasured	O
to	O
their	O
fair	O
value	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
each	O
reporting	O
period.	O
The	O
resulting	O
gain	O
or	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
immediately	O
unless	O
the	O
derivative	O
is	O
designated	O
and	O
effective	O
as	O
a	O
hedging	O
instrument	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
event	O
the	O
timing	O
of	O
the	O
recognition	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
hedge	O
relationship.	O
(	O
f	O
)	O
Impairment	O
of	O
assets	O
At	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
the	O
entity	O
reviews	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
its	O
tangible	O
and	O
intangible	O
assets	O
to	O
determine	O
whether	O
there	O
is	O
any	O
indication	O
that	O
those	O
assets	O
have	O
suffered	O
an	O
impairment	O
loss.	O
If	O
any	O
such	O
indication	O
exists	O
,	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
is	O
estimated	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
determine	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
loss	O
(	O
if	O
any	O
)	O
.	O

Where	O
the	O
asset	O
does	O
not	O
generate	O
cash	O
flows	O
that	O
are	O
independent	O
from	O
other	O
assets	O
,	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
estimates	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
to	O
which	O
the	O
asset	O
belongs.	O
Recoverable	O
amount	O
is	O
the	O
higher	O
of	O
fair	O
value	O
less	O
costs	O
to	O
sell	O
and	O
value	O
in	O
use.	O
In	O
assessing	O
value	O
in	O
use	O
,	O
the	O
estimated	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
are	O
discounted	O
to	O
their	O
present	O
value	O
using	O
a	O
pre-	O
tax	O
discount	O
rate	O
that	O
reflects	O
current	O
market	O
assessments	O
of	O
the	O
time	O
value	O
of	O
money	O
and	O
the	O
risks	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
asset	O
for	O
which	O
the	O
estimates	O
of	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
have	O
not	O
been	O
adjusted.	O
If	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
(	O
or	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
)	O
is	O
estimated	O
to	O
be	O
less	O
than	O
its	O
carrying	O
amount	O
,	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
(	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
)	O
is	O
reduced	O
to	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount.	O
An	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
immediately	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
relevant	O
asset	O
is	O
carried	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
the	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
a	O
revaluation	O
decrease.	O
Where	O
an	O
impairment	O
loss	O
subsequently	O
reverses	O
,	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
(	O
cash-	O
generating	O
unit	O
)	O
is	O
increased	O
to	O
the	O
revised	O
estimate	O
of	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
,	O
but	O
only	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
the	O
increased	O
carrying	O
amount	O
does	O
not	O
exceed	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
that	O
would	O
have	O
been	O
determined	O
had	O
no	O
impairment	O
loss	O
been	O
recognised	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
(	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
)	O
in	O
prior	O
periods.	O
A	O
reversal	O
of	O
an	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
immediately	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
relevant	O
asset	O
is	O
carried	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
the	O
reversal	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
a	O
revaluation	O
increase.	O
(	O
g	O
)	O
Property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
Each	O
class	O
of	O
property	O
,	O
including	O
land	O
,	O
buildings	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
is	O
carried	O
at	O
cost	O
less	O
,	O
where	O
applicable	O
,	O
any	O
accumulated	O
depreciation.	O
Depreciation	O
Depreciation	O
is	O
provided	O
on	O
a	O
straight	O
line	O
basis	O
on	O
all	O
property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O

,	O
other	O
than	O

the	O
useful	O
lives	O
of	O

asset	O
to	O

for	O

(	O
h	O
)	O
Trade	O
and	O

Trade	O

and	O
other	O
accounts	O
payable	O

when	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
becomes	O

to	O

of	O

and	O
services.	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
Provisions	O
Provisions	O
are	O
recognised	O
when	O
the	O
entity	O
has	O
a	O
present	O
obligation	O
,	O
the	O
future	O
sacrifice	O
of	O
economic	O
benefits	O
is	O
probable	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
provision	O
can	O
be	O
measured	O
reliably.	O
The	O
amount	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
provision	O
is	O
the	O
best	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
consideration	O
required	O
to	O
settle	O
the	O
present	O
obligation	O
at	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
taking	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
risks	O
and	O
uncertainties	O
surrounding	O
the	O
obligation.	O
Where	O
a	O
provision	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
the	O
cashflows	O
estimated	O
to	O
settle	O
the	O
present	O
obligation	O
,	O
its	O
carrying	O
amount	O
is	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
those	O
cashflows.	O
When	O
some	O
or	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
economic	O
benefits	O
required	O
to	O
settle	O
a	O
provision	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
recovered	O
from	O
a	O
third	O
party	O
,	O
the	O
receivable	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
asset	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
virtually	O
certain	O
that	O
recovery	O
will	O
be	O
received	O
and	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
receivable	O
can	O
be	O
measured	O
reliably.	O
(	O
j	O
)	O
Revenue	O
recognition	O
Dividend	O
and	O
interest	O
revenue	O
Dividend	O
revenue	O
is	O
recognised	O
on	O
a	O
receivable	O
basis.	O
Interest	O
revenue	O
is	O
recognised	O
on	O
a	O
time	O
proportionate	O
basis	O
that	O
takes	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
effective	O
yield	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
asset.	O
(	O
k	O
)	O
Income	O
tax	O
Current	O
tax	O
Current	O
tax	O
is	O
calculated	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
income	O
taxes	O
payable	O
or	O
recoverable	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
the	O
taxable	O
profit	O
or	O
tax	O
loss	O
for	O
the	O
period.	O
It	O
is	O
calculated	O
using	O
tax	O
rates	O
and	O
tax	O
laws	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
by	O
reporting	O
date.	O
Current	O
tax	O
for	O
current	O
and	O
prior	O
periods	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
liability	O
(	O
or	O
asset	O
)	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
unpaid	O
(	O
or	O
refundable	O
)	O
.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
accounted	O
for	O
using	O
the	O
comprehensive	O
liability	O
method	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
from	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
and	O
the	O
corresponding	O
tax	O
base	O
of	O
those	O
items.	O

Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O

46	O
2016	O
Annual	O

1.	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
(	O
k	O
)	O
Income	O
tax	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
In	O
principle	O
,	O
deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
are	O
recognised	O
for	O
all	O
taxable	O
temporary	O
differences.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
sufficient	O
taxable	O
amounts	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
against	O
which	O
deductible	O
temporary	O
differences	O
or	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses	O
and	O
tax	O
offsets	O
can	O
be	O
utilised.	O
However	O
,	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
not	O
recognised	O
if	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
giving	O
rise	O
to	O
them	O
arise	O
from	O
the	O
initial	O
recognition	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
(	O
other	O
than	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
of	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
)	O
which	O
affects	O
neither	O
taxable	O
income	O
nor	O
accounting	O
profit.	O
Furthermore	O
,	O
a	O
deferred	O
tax	O
liability	O
is	O
not	O
recognised	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
taxable	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
from	O
goodwill.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
are	O
recognised	O
for	O
taxable	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
on	O
investments	O
in	O
subsidiaries	O
,	O
branches	O
,	O
associates	O
and	O
joint	O
ventures	O
except	O
where	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
is	O
able	O
to	O
control	O
the	O
reversal	O
of	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
will	O
not	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
arising	O
from	O
deductible	O
temporary	O
differences	O
associated	O
with	O
these	O
investments	O
and	O
interests	O
are	O
only	O
recognised	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
there	O
will	O
be	O
sufficient	O
taxable	O
profits	O
against	O
which	O
to	O
utilise	O
the	O
benefits	O
of	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
they	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
the	O
tax	O
rates	O
that	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
apply	O
to	O
the	O
period	O
(	O
s	O
)	O
when	O
the	O
asset	O
and	O
liability	O
giving	O
rise	O
to	O
them	O
are	O
realised	O
or	O
settled	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
tax	O
rates	O
(	O
and	O
tax	O
laws	O
)	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
by	O
reporting	O
date.	O
The	O
measurement	O
of	O
deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
and	O
assets	O
reflects	O
the	O
tax	O
consequences	O
that	O
would	O
follow	O
from	O
the	O
manner	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
expects	O
,	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
to	O
recover	O
or	O
settle	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
its	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
offset	O
when	O
they	O
relate	O
to	O
income	O
taxes	O
levied	O
by	O
the	O
same	O
taxation	O
authority	O
and	O
the	O
company	O
intends	O
to	O
settle	O
its	O
current	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
on	O
a	O
net	O
basis.	O
Current	O
and	O
deferred	O
tax	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
Current	O
and	O
deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O

or	O
income	O
in	O
the	O
profit	O
and	O
loss	O

to	O

other	O

equity	O

in	O

in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O

determination	O
of	O

or	O

(	O

)	O
Goods	O
and	O
services	O
tax	O
Revenues	O

and	O
assets	O
are	O

net	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O

and	O

tax	O
(	O

)	O
,	O

Australian	O

Office	O
(	O
ATO	O
)	O
.	O

In	O

the	O
GST	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
an	O
item	O
of	O
the	O
expense.	O
Receivables	O
and	O

are	O
stated	O

the	O

of	O
GST	O
included.	O
The	O

of	O

,	O
or	O

to	O

is	O

as	O
a	O

asset	O
or	O

in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position.	O

are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O

of	O

a	O

The	O

of	O

and	O

Employee	O

employee	O
benefits	O

for	O

to	O
be	O

within	O
12	O
months	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
current	O
liabilities	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
employees'	O
services	O
up	O
to	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
the	O
amounts	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
paid	O
when	O
the	O
liabilities	O
are	O
settled.	O
Other	O
long-term	O
employee	O
benefits	O
The	O
liability	O
for	O
annual	O
leave	O
and	O
long	O
service	O
leave	O
not	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
settled	O
within	O
12	O
months	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
non-current	O
liabilities	O
,	O
provided	O
there	O
is	O
an	O
unconditional	O
right	O
to	O
defer	O
settlement	O
of	O
the	O
liability.	O
The	O

is	O
measured	O
as	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
expected	O
future	O
payments	O
to	O
be	O
made	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
services	O
provided	O
by	O
employees	O
up	O
to	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
using	O
the	O
projected	O
unit	O
credit	O
method.	O
Consideration	O
is	O
given	O
to	O
expected	O
future	O
wage	O
and	O
salary	O
levels	O
,	O
experience	O
of	O
employee	O
departures	O
and	O
periods	O
of	O
service.	O
Expected	O
future	O
payments	O
are	O
discounted	O
using	O
market	O
yields	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
on	O
national	O
government	O
bonds	O
with	O
terms	O
to	O
maturity	O
and	O
currency	O
that	O
match	O
,	O
as	O
closely	O
as	O
possible	O
,	O
the	O
estimated	O
future	O
cash	O
outflows.	O
Defined	O
contribution	O
superannuation	O
expense	O
Contributions	O
to	O
defined	O
contribution	O
superannuation	O
plans	O
are	O
expensed	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
they	O
are	O
incurred.	O
Share-based	O
payments	O
Equity-settled	O
and	O
cash-settled	O
share-based	O
compensation	O
benefits	O
are	O
provided	O
to	O
employees.	O
Equity-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
awards	O
of	O
shares	O
,	O
or	O
options	O
over	O
shares	O
that	O
are	O
provided	O
to	O
employees	O
in	O
exchange	O
for	O
the	O
rendering	O
of	O
services.	O
Cash-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
awards	O
of	O
cash	O
for	O
the	O
exchange	O
of	O
services	O
,	O
where	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
cash	O
is	O
determined	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
share	O
price.	O
The	O
costs	O
of	O
equity-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
on	O
grant	O
date.	O
Fair	O
value	O
is	O
independently	O
determined	O
using	O
either	O
the	O
Binomial	O
or	O
Black-Scholes	O
option	O
pricing	O
model	O
that	O
takes	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
exercise	O
price	O
,	O
the	O
term	O
of	O
the	O
option	O
,	O
the	O
impact	O
of	O
dilution	O
,	O
the	O
share	O
price	O
at	O
grant	O
date	O
and	O
expected	O
price	O
volatility	O
of	O
the	O
underlying	O
share	O
,	O
the	O
expected	O
dividend	O
yield	O
and	O
the	O
risk	O
free	O
interest	O
rate	O
for	O
the	O
term	O
of	O
the	O
option	O
,	O
together	O
with	O
non-	O
vesting	O
conditions	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
determine	O
whether	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
receives	O
the	O
services	O
that	O
entitle	O
the	O
employees	O
to	O
receive	O
payment.	O
No	O
account	O
is	O
taken	O
of	O
any	O
other	O
vesting	O
conditions.	O
The	O
costs	O
of	O
equity-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
expense	O
with	O
a	O
corresponding	O
increase	O
in	O
equity	O
over	O
the	O
vesting	O
period.	O
The	O
cumulative	O
charge	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
is	O
calculated	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
grant	O
date	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
award	O
,	O
the	O
best	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
awards	O
that	O
are	O
likely	O
to	O
vest	O
and	O
the	O
expired	O
portion	O
of	O
the	O
vesting	O
period.	O
The	O
amount	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
for	O
the	O
period	O
is	O
the	O
cumulative	O
amount	O
calculated	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
less	O
amounts	O
already	O
recognised	O
in	O
previous	O
periods.	O

(	O

)	O

of	O

of	O

All	O

in	O

are	O

in	O
profit	O
or	O

of	O

the	O

to	O

conditions	O
are	O
taken	O
into	O

in	O

value.	O
Therefore	O

awards	O
subject	O
to	O

conditions	O
are	O
considered	O
to	O

irrespective	O

market	O

other	O

are	O

If	O

are	O
modified	O
,	O
as	O
a	O
minimum	O
an	O

is	O

if	O

has	O
not	O

made.	O

of	O
the	O
share-based	O
compensation	O
benefit	O
as	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O

If	O

or	O
employee	O
and	O
is	O
not	O
satisfied	O
during	O
the	O

period	O
,	O
any	O
remaining	O
expense	O
for	O
the	O
award	O
is	O
recognised	O
over	O
the	O
remaining	O

all	O

(	O

)	O
(	O
p	O
)	O
Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
Capitalised	O
exploration	O
costs	O
are	O
reviewed	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
to	O
test	O
whether	O
an	O
indication	O
of	O
impairment	O
exists.	O
If	O
any	O
such	O
indication	O
exists	O
,	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
capitalised	O
exploration	O
costs	O
is	O
estimated	O
to	O
determine	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
loss	O
(	O
if	O
any	O
)	O
.	O

Where	O
an	O
impairment	O
loss	O
subsequently	O
reverses	O
,	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
is	O
increased	O
to	O
the	O
revised	O
estimate	O
of	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
,	O
but	O
only	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
the	O
increased	O
carrying	O
amount	O
does	O
not	O
exceed	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
that	O
would	O
have	O
been	O
determined	O
had	O
no	O
impairment	O
loss	O
been	O
recognised	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
in	O
previous	O
years.	O
Where	O
a	O
decision	O
is	O
made	O
to	O
proceed	O
with	O
development	O
,	O
accumulated	O
expenditure	O
is	O
tested	O
for	O
impairment	O
and	O
transferred	O
to	O
capitalised	O
development	O
and	O
then	O
amortised	O
over	O
the	O
life	O
of	O
the	O
reserve	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
once	O
mining	O
operations	O
have	O
commenced.	O
Development	O
expenditure	O
is	O
recognised	O
at	O
cost	O
less	O
any	O
impairment	O
of	O
losses.	O
Where	O
commercial	O
production	O
in	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
has	O
commenced	O
,	O
the	O
associated	O
costs	O
are	O
amortised	O
over	O
the	O
life	O
of	O
reserves	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest.	O
Changes	O
in	O
factors	O
such	O
as	O
estimates	O
of	O
proved	O
and	O
probable	O
reserves	O
that	O
affect	O
unit	O
of	O
production	O
calculations	O
are	O
dealt	O
with	O
on	O
a	O
prospective	O
basis.	O
(	O
q	O
)	O
Fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
When	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
financial	O
or	O
non-financial	O
,	O
is	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
for	O
recognition	O
or	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
,	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
price	O
that	O
would	O
be	O
received	O
to	O
sell	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
paid	O
to	O
transfer	O
a	O
liability	O
in	O
an	O
orderly	O
transaction	O
between	O
market	O
participants	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date	O
;	O
and	O
assumes	O
that	O
the	O
transaction	O
will	O
take	O
place	O
either	O
:	O
in	O
the	O
principle	O
market	O
;	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
absence	O
of	O
a	O
principal	O
market	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
most	O
advantageous	O
market.	O
Fair	O
value	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
the	O
assumptions	O
that	O
market	O
participants	O
would	O
use	O
when	O
pricing	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
assuming	O
they	O
act	O
in	O
their	O
economic	O
best	O
interest.	O
For	O
non-financial	O
assets	O
,	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
its	O
highest	O
and	O
best	O
use.	O
Valuation	O
techniques	O
that	O
are	O
appropriate	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
sufficient	O
data	O
are	O
available	O
to	O
measure	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
are	O
used	O
,	O
maximising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
relevant	O
observable	O
inputs	O
and	O
minimising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
unobservable	O
inputs.	O
Assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
are	O
classified	O
,	O
into	O
three	O
levels	O
,	O
using	O
a	O
fair	O
value	O
hierarchy	O
that	O
reflects	O
the	O
significance	O
of	O
the	O
inputs	O
used	O
in	O
making	O
the	O
measurements.	O
Classifications	O
are	O
reviewed	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
transfers	O
between	O
levels	O
are	O
determined	O
based	O
on	O
a	O
reassessment	O
of	O
the	O
lowest	O
level	O
input	O
that	O
is	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement.	O
For	O
recurring	O
and	O
non-recurring	O
fair	O
value	O
measurements	O
,	O
external	O
valuers	O
may	O
be	O
used	O
when	O
internal	O
expertise	O
is	O
either	O
not	O
available	O
or	O
when	O
the	O
valuation	O
is	O
deemed	O
to	O
be	O
significant.	O
External	O
valuers	O
are	O
selected	O
based	O
on	O
market	O
knowledge	O
and	O
reputation.	O
Where	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
significant	O
change	O
in	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
from	O
one	O
period	O
to	O
another	O
,	O
an	O
analysis	O
is	O
undertaken	O
,	O
which	O
includes	O
a	O
verification	O
of	O
the	O
major	O
inputs	O
applied	O
in	O
the	O
latest	O
valuation	O
and	O
a	O
comparison	O
,	O
where	O
applicable	O
,	O
with	O
external	O
sources	O
of	O
data.	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O
