r	O
)	O
Contributed	O
equity	O
Ordinary	O
shares	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
equity	O
Incremental	O
costs	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
new	O
shares	O
or	O
options	O
are	O
shown	O
in	O
equity	O
as	O
a	O
deduction	O
net	O
of	O
tax	O
,	O
from	O
the	O
proceeds.	O
Incremental	O
costs	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
new	O
shares	O
or	O
options	O
for	O
the	O
acquisition	O
of	O
a	O
business	O
are	O
not	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
purchase	O
consideration.	O
If	O
the	O
entity	O
reacquires	O
its	O
own	O
equity	O
instruments	O
,	O
e.g.	O
as	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
a	O
share	O
buyback	O
,	O
those	O
instruments	O
are	O
deducted	O
from	O
equity	O
and	O
the	O
associated	O
shares	O
are	O
cancelled.	O
No	O
gain	O
or	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
the	O
consideration	O
paid	O
including	O
any	O
directly	O
attributable	O
incremental	O
costs	O
(	O
net	O
of	O
income	O
taxes	O
)	O
is	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity.	O
(	O
s	O
)	O
Acquisition	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
goodwill	O
The	O
purchase	O
method	O
of	O
accounting	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
account	O
for	O
all	O
acquisitions	O
of	O
assets	O
(	O
including	O
business	O
combinations	O
)	O
regardless	O
of	O
whether	O
equity	O
instruments	O
or	O
other	O
assets	O
are	O
acquired.	O
Cost	O
is	O
measured	O
as	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
assets	O
given	O
,	O
shares	O
issued	O
or	O
liabilities	O
incurred	O
or	O
assumed	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
exchange	O
plus	O
costs	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
acquisition.	O
Where	O
equity	O
instruments	O
are	O
issued	O
in	O
an	O
acquisition	O
,	O
the	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
instruments	O
is	O
their	O
published	O
market	O
price	O
as	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
exchange	O
unless	O
,	O
in	O
rare	O
circumstances	O
,	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
demonstrated	O
that	O
the	O
published	O
price	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
exchange	O
is	O
an	O
unreliable	O
measure	O
of	O
fair	O
value.	O
Transaction	O
costs	O
arising	O
on	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
equity	O
instruments	O
are	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity.	O
Identifiable	O
assets	O
acquired	O
and	O
liabilities	O
and	O
contingent	O
liabilities	O
assumed	O
in	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
are	O
measured	O
initially	O
at	O
their	O
fair	O
values	O
at	O
the	O
acquisition	O
date	O
,	O
irrespective	O
of	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
any	O
minority	O
interest.	O
The	O
excess	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
over	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
Entity	O
’	O
s	O
share	O
of	O
the	O
identifiable	O
net	O
assets	O
acquired	O
is	O
recorded	O
as	O
goodwill	O
and	O
not	O
amortised	O
,	O
but	O
tested	O
for	O
impairment	O
annually	O
and	O
whenever	O
there	O
is	O
an	O
indication	O
that	O
the	O
goodwill	O
may	O
be	O
impaired.	O
Any	O
impairment	O
is	O
recognised	O
immediately	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
is	O
not	O
subsequently	O
reversed.	O
If	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
is	O
less	O
than	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
business	O
combination	O
,	O
the	O
difference	O
is	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O
Where	O
settlement	O
of	O
any	O
part	O
of	O
cash	O
consideration	O
is	O
deferred	O
,	O
the	O
amounts	O
payable	O
in	O
the	O
future	O
are	O
discounted	O
to	O
their	O
present	O
value	O
as	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
exchange.	O
The	O
discount	O
rate	O
used	O
is	O
the	O
Entity	O
’	O
s	O
incremental	O
borrowing	O
rate	O
,	O
being	O
the	O
rate	O
at	O
which	O
a	O
similar	O
borrowing	O
could	O
be	O
obtained	O
from	O
an	O
independent	O
financier	O
under	O
comparable	O
terms	O
and	O
conditions.	O
(	O
t	O
)	O
Trade	O
receivables	O
Trade	O
receivables	O
are	O
recognised	O
initially	O
at	O
fair	O
value.	O
Collectability	O
of	O
trade	O
receivables	O
is	O
reviewed	O
on	O
an	O
ongoing	O
basis.	O
Debts	O
which	O
are	O
known	O
to	O
be	O
uncollectible	O
are	O
written	O
off.	O
An	O
allowance	O
for	O
doubtful	O
receivables	O
is	O
established	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
objective	O
evidence	O
that	O
the	O
Entity	O
will	O
not	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
collect	O
all	O
amounts	O
due	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
original	O
terms	O
of	O
receivables.	O
The	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
allowance	O
is	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
and	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
estimated	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
,	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
rate.	O
The	O
movement	O
of	O
the	O
allowance	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O

The	O

’	O
s	O
objectives	O
when	O
managing	O
capital	O
are	O
to	O

their	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
so	O
it	O
can	O
continue	O
its	O
activities	O
and	O
provide	O
returns	O
for	O

and	O
other	O

is	O
the	O
board	O
’	O
s	O
current	O
policy	O
,	O
which	O
it	O
has	O
operated	O

the	O
company	O
’	O
s	O
inception	O
,	O
that	O
given	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
its	O
business	O
,	O
to	O
fund	O
its	O
operations	O

the	O
use	O
of	O
external	O

of	O

annual	O
budget	O
to	O
assess	O
its	O

capital	O
needs	O
and	O
to	O

capital	O
is	O
available	O
to	O
meet	O
those	O
needs.	O

financial	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
company	O
is	O
measured	O
on	O
a	O
regular	O
basis	O
against	O
this	O
budget	O
to	O
ensure	O
that	O
the	O
company	O
is	O
meeting	O
its	O
cash	O
inflow	O
and	O
outflow	O
targets.	O

order	O

its	O
capital	O
structure	O
and	O
to	O

its	O

of	O
no	O

CONTINGENCIES	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
Malian	O
subsidiary	O
SOCAF	O
sarl	O
has	O
obligations	O
in	O
the	O
event	O
that	O
it	O
commences	O
mining	O
at	O
either	O
its	O
Boutounguissi	O
Sud	O
or	O
Aourou	O
concessions	O
in	O
Mali.	O
Under	O
the	O
granted	O
concessions	O
,	O
the	O
Government	O
of	O
Mali	O
is	O
entitled	O
to	O
a	O
10%	O
interest	O
in	O
any	O
mining	O
company	O
established	O
to	O
exploit	O
a	O
resource	O
and	O
may	O
secure	O
a	O
further	O
10%	O
on	O
commercial	O
terms.	O
Pursuant	O
to	O
the	O
concessions	O
,	O
upon	O
commencement	O
of	O
mining	O
an	O
amount	O
of	O
$USD1	O
,	O
528	O
,	O
000	O
for	O
Aourou	O
and	O
$USD343	O
,	O
735	O
for	O
Boutounguissi	O
Sud	O
is	O
payable	O
to	O
the	O
Malian	O
government	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
past	O
exploration	O
costs	O
incurred	O
by	O
it.	O
Pursuant	O
to	O
an	O
agreement	O
with	O
its	O
founder	O
M.	O
B	O
Camara	O
an	O
amount	O
of	O
FCFA	O
200	O
,	O
000	O
,	O
000	O
(	O
approximately	O
A$410	O
,	O
800	O
)	O
is	O
payable	O
from	O
available	O
cash-flow	O
from	O
mining	O
,	O
after	O
reimbursement	O
of	O
the	O
Malian	O
Government	O
for	O
past	O
exploration.	O
As	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
acquisition	O
of	O
Compass	O
Gold	O
Mali	O
BVI	O
Corp	O
in	O
December	O
2013	O
,	O
part	O

18.	O
FINANCIAL	O
RISK	O
MANAGEMENT	O
The	O
Group	O
attempts	O
to	O
mitigate	O
risks	O
that	O
may	O
affect	O
its	O
future	O
performance	O
through	O
a	O
process	O
of	O
identifying	O
,	O
assessing	O
,	O
reporting	O
and	O
managing	O
risks	O
of	O
corporate	O
significance.	O
The	O
board	O
considers	O
the	O
principal	O
risks	O
of	O
our	O
business	O
,	O
particularly	O
during	O
the	O
strategic	O
planning	O
and	O
budget	O
processes.	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
principal	O
financial	O
instruments	O
comprise	O
cash	O
,	O
short-term	O
deposits	O
and	O
investments	O
in	O
shares.	O
The	O
main	O
purpose	O
of	O
these	O
financial	O
instruments	O
is	O
to	O
fund	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
operations.	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
various	O
other	O
financial	O
instruments	O
such	O
as	O
trade	O
debtors	O
,	O
trade	O
creditors	O
and	O
borrowings	O
,	O
which	O
arise	O
directly	O
from	O
its	O
operations.	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O

62	O
2016	O

FINANCIAL	O
RISK	O
MANAGEMENT	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
The	O
main	O
risks	O
arising	O
from	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
financial	O
instruments	O
is	O
cash	O
flow	O
interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
and	O
foreign	O
currency	O
risk.	O
Other	O
minor	O
risks	O
include	O
credit	O
risk	O
,	O
liquidity	O
risk	O
and	O
capital	O
risk	O
management.	O
The	O
board	O
reviews	O
and	O
adopts	O
policies	O
for	O
each	O
of	O
these	O
risks	O
which	O
are	O
summarised	O
below.	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
Credit	O
risk	O
The	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
any	O
material	O
credit	O
risk	O
exposure	O
to	O
any	O
single	O
debtor	O
or	O
group	O
of	O
debtors	O
under	O
financial	O
instruments	O
entered	O
into	O
by	O
the	O
Group.	O
Financial	O
instruments	O
other	O
than	O
receivables	O
that	O
potentially	O
subject	O
the	O
Group	O
to	O
concentrations	O
of	O
credit	O
risk	O
consist	O
principally	O
of	O
cash	O
deposits.	O
The	O
Group	O
places	O
its	O
cash	O
deposits	O
with	O
high	O
credit	O
quality	O
financial	O
institutions	O
,	O
being	O
in	O
Australia	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
major	O
Australian	O
(	O
big	O
four	O
)	O
banks.	O

holdings	O
in	O
other	O
countries	O
are	O
not	O
significant.	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
cash	O
deposits	O
are	O
all	O
on	O
call	O
or	O
in	O
term	O
deposits	O
and	O
attract	O
a	O
rate	O
of	O
interest	O
at	O
normal	O
short	O
term	O
money	O
market	O
rates.	O

maximum	O
amount	O
of	O
credit	O
risk	O
the	O

considers	O

would	O
be	O

be	O
$10	O
,	O
831	O
,	O
716	O
(	O
2015	O
:	O
$871	O
,	O
871	O
)	O

and	O

Foreign	O
Exchange	O
Risk	O
A	O
risk	O
arises	O
when	O
future	O
commercial	O
transactions	O
and	O
recognised	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
denominated	O
in	O
a	O
currency	O
other	O
than	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
’	O
s	O
functional	O
currency.	O
The	O
Group	O
operates	O
internationally	O
,	O
with	O
its	O
major	O
assets	O
being	O
held	O
in	O
Mali	O
,	O
West	O
Africa	O
and	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
risk	O
arising	O
from	O
currency	O
exposures	O
to	O
the	O
Euro	O
,	O
FCFA	O
(	O
fixed	O
to	O
the	O
Euro	O
)	O
and	O
US	O
Dollar.	O
Historically	O
,	O
given	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
expenditure	O
and	O
available	O
funding	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
considered	O
its	O
exposure	O
to	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
risk	O
was	O
minimal	O
and	O
hedging	O
policies	O
were	O
not	O
adopted.	O
Following	O
the	O
$10	O
million	O
capital	O
raising	O
completed	O
in	O
June	O
2016	O
,	O
given	O
the	O
particularly	O
volatile	O
and	O
uncertain	O
position	O
of	O
foreign	O
currency	O
markets	O
globally	O
at	O
that	O
time	O
and	O

that	O
a	O
substantial	O
exploration	O
program	O
would	O
be	O
completed	O
in	O
the	O
following	O
12	O
months	O

and	O
management	O
considered	O

to	O
enter	O
into	O
forward	O

contracts	O
to	O

some	O
of	O
the	O
possible	O
foreign	O
currency	O
risks	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
for	O
the	O
following	O
12	O
months.	O

for	O

change	O
in	O

currency	O

number	O
below	O

increase	O
in	O
profit	O

dollar	O

10%	O
against	O
the	O

$0.07	O
per	O

(	O
2015	O
:	O
$0.10	O
)	O
.	O

(	O
f	O
)	O
Share	O
option	O
plan	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
an	O
Incentive	O
Option	O
Scheme	O
(	O
“	O
Scheme	O
”	O
)	O
for	O
executives	O
and	O
employees	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O
In	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
provisions	O
of	O
the	O
Scheme	O
,	O
as	O
approved	O
by	O
the	O
shareholders	O
at	O
the	O
August	O
2016	O
annual	O
general	O
meeting	O
,	O
executives	O
and	O
employees	O
may	O
be	O
granted	O
options	O
at	O
the	O
discretion	O
of	O
the	O
directors.	O
Each	O
share	O
option	O
converts	O
into	O
one	O
ordinary	O
share	O
of	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
on	O
exercise.	O
No	O
amounts	O
are	O
paid	O
or	O
are	O
payable	O
by	O
the	O
recipient	O
on	O
receipt	O
of	O
the	O
option.	O
The	O
options	O
carry	O
neither	O
rights	O
of	O
dividends	O
nor	O
voting	O
rights.	O
Options	O
may	O
be	O
exercised	O
at	O
any	O
time	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
vesting	O
to	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
their	O
expiry.	O
Options	O
issued	O
to	O
directors	O
are	O
not	O
issued	O
under	O
the	O
Scheme	O
but	O
are	O
subject	O
to	O
approval	O
by	O
shareholders.	O

Limited	O

Act	O

from	O

,	O

to	O

or	O

Note	O
1	O
,	O

directors	O
also	O
state	O
,	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O

Standard	O
AASB	O
101	O
Presentation	O
of	O
Financial	O
Statements	O
,	O
that	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
comply	O
withInternational	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards.	O
Auditor	O
’	O
s	O
Responsibility	O
Our	O
responsibility	O
is	O
to	O
express	O
an	O
opinion	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
based	O
on	O
our	O
audit.	O
We	O
conducted	O
our	O
audit	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Auditing	O
Standards.	O
Those	O
standards	O
require	O
that	O
we	O
comply	O
with	O
relevant	O
ethical	O
requirements	O
relating	O
to	O
audit	O
engagements	O
and	O
plan	O
and	O
perform	O
the	O
audit	O
to	O
obtain	O
reasonable	O
assurance	O
about	O
whether	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement.	O
An	O
audit	O
involves	O
performing	O
procedures	O
to	O
obtain	O
audit	O
evidence	O
about	O
the	O
amounts	O
and	O
disclosures	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
report.	O
The	O
procedures	O
selected	O
depend	O
on	O
the	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
judgement	O
,	O
including	O
the	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
risks	O
of	O
material	O
misstatement	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error.	O
In	O
making	O
those	O
risk	O
assessments	O
,	O
the	O
auditor	O
considers	O
internal	O
control	O
relevant	O
to	O
the	O
company	O
’	O
s	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
that	O
gives	O
a	O
true	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
design	O
audit	O
procedures	O
that	O
are	O
appropriate	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
expressing	O
an	O
opinion	O
on	O
the	O
effectiveness	O
of	O
the	O
company	O
’	O
s	O
internal	O
control.	O
An	O
audit	O
also	O
includes	O
evaluating	O
the	O
appropriateness	O
of	O
accounting	O
policies	O
used	O
and	O
the	O
reasonableness	O
of	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
made	O
by	O
the	O
directors	O
,	O
as	O

as	O
evaluating	O
the	O
overall	O
presentation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report.	O
We	O
believe	O
that	O
the	O
audit	O

we	O
have	O
obtained	O
is	O
sufficient	O
and	O
appropriate	O
to	O

our	O
audit	O

the	O
future	O
and	O

at	O

project	O

.	O

and	O

Company	O

Nelson	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O
34	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
FOR	O
THE	O
YEAR	O
ENDED	O
30	O
JUNE	O
2021	O
1.	O
Corporate	O
information	O
This	O
annual	O
report	O
covers	O
Nelson	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
(	O
the	O
“	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
”	O
)	O
,	O
a	O
company	O
y	O
incorporated	O
in	O
Australia	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021.	O
The	O
presentation	O
currency	O
of	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
is	O
Australian	O
Dollars	O
(	O
“	O
$	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

A	O
description	O
of	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
’	O
s	O
l	O
operations	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
review	O
and	O
results	O
of	O
operations	O
in	O
the	O
Directors	O
’	O
Report.	O
The	O
n	O
Directors	O
’	O
Report	O
is	O
not	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
The	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
is	O
a	O
for-profit	O
entity	O
and	O
limited	O
by	O
shares	O
incorporated	O
in	O
Australia	O
whose	O
shares	O
are	O
traded	O
under	O
the	O
ASX	O
code	O
o	O

“	O
NES	O
”	O
.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
were	O
authorised	O
for	O
issue	O
on	O
30	O
September	O
2021	O
by	O
the	O
Directors	O
of	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity.	O
The	O
Directors	O
have	O
the	O
power	O
to	O
amend	O
and	O
reissue	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
The	O
principal	O
accounting	O
policies	O
adopted	O

ceases.	O

u	O

Exploration	O

expenditure	O
l	O

expenditure	O
capitalised	O
,	O

Company	O
’	O
s	O

policy	O
where	O
a	O

is	O
indicated	O

requires	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
as	O
to	O
whether	O
successful	O

and	O

n	O

,	O

,	O
of	O
the	O
respective	O
areas	O
of	O
interest	O
will	O
be	O

This	O
assessment	O
requires	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
about	O
the	O
resources	O
,	O
the	O
timing	O
of	O
expected	O
cash	O
o	O

flows	O
and	O
future	O
capital	O
requirements.	O
If	O
,	O

under	O

policy	O

unlikely	O
,	O

profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
Costs	O

of	O

facility	O
from	O

of	O

plant	O
,	O

and	O

r	O

,	O
waste	O

,	O

of	O

site	O

with	O

of	O
the	O
mining	O
e	O

Such	O

been	O

using	O

of	O
future	O
costs	O
,	O
current	O
legal	O
requirements	O
and	O
technology	O
and	O
discounted	O
by	O
a	O
pre-tax	O
rate	O
that	O
reflects	O
current	O
market	O
p	O
assessments	O
of	O
the	O
time	O
value	O
of	O
money	O
and	O
the	O
risks	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
restoration	O
works.	O
Any	O

in	O
the	O

for	O

costs	O

for	O
on	O
a	O

basis.	O
In	O

of	O

,	O

have	O
r	O

year	O
of	O
o	O

2.	O
Accounting	O
policies	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
Recoverability	O
of	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
y	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
calculated	O
at	O
the	O
tax	O
rates	O
that	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
apply	O
to	O
the	O
period	O
when	O
the	O
asset	O
is	O
realised	O
or	O
liability	O
is	O
settled.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
credited	O
in	O
the	O
income	O
statement	O
except	O
where	O
it	O
l	O
relates	O
to	O
items	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
credited	O
directly	O
to	O
equity	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
the	O
deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
adjusted	O
n	O
directly	O
against	O
equity.	O
Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
future	O
tax	O
profits	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
against	O
which	O
deductible	O
temporary	O
differences	O
can	O
be	O
o	O

utilised.	O
The	O
amount	O
of	O
benefits	O
brought	O
to	O
account	O
or	O
which	O
may	O
be	O
realised	O
in	O
the	O
future	O
is	O
based	O

sheet	O
method	O

date.	O

are	O
l	O

unused	O

s	O

Capital	O
management	O
The	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
objectives	O
when	O
managing	O
capital	O
are	O
to	O
safeguard	O
its	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
l	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
so	O
that	O
it	O
may	O
continue	O
to	O
provide	O
returns	O
for	O
shareholders	O
and	O
benefits	O
for	O
other	O
n	O
stakeholders.	O
Due	O
to	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
activities	O
,	O
being	O
mineral	O
exploration	O
,	O
it	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
ready	O
access	O
to	O
credit	O
facilities	O
and	O
therefore	O
is	O
not	O
subject	O
to	O
any	O
externally	O
imposed	O
o	O

capital	O
requirements	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
primary	O
source	O
of	O
Company	O
funding	O
being	O
equity	O
raisings.	O
Accordingly	O
,	O
the	O
objective	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
capital	O
risk	O
management	O
is	O
to	O
balance	O
the	O
current	O
working	O
capital	O
position	O
against	O
the	O
requirements	O
to	O
meet	O
exploration	O
programmes	O
and	O
corporate	O
overheads.	O
This	O
is	O
achieved	O
by	O
maintaining	O
appropriate	O
liquidity	O
to	O
meet	O
anticipated	O
e	O
operating	O
requirements	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
view	O
to	O
initiating	O
appropriate	O
capital	O
raisings	O
as	O
required.	O
s	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
Ordinary	O
shares	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
equity.	O

costs	O
directly	O

to	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
u	O
new	O
shares	O
or	O
options	O
are	O
shown	O
in	O
equity	O
as	O
a	O
deduction	O
,	O
net	O
of	O
tax	O
,	O
from	O
the	O

u	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
The	O
Company	O
measures	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O

with	O
employees	O
by	O

l	O
the	O

of	O

instruments	O

at	O
which	O

value	O
is	O
a	O

by	O
using	O
the	O
Black-Scholes	O
model	O
taking	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
terms	O
and	O
conditions	O
upon	O
which	O
the	O
instruments	O
were	O
granted.	O
n	O
17.	O
Financial	O
instruments	O
o	O

Financial	O
risk	O
management	O
objectives	O
,	O
policies	O
and	O
processes	O
The	O
Company	O
has	O
exposure	O
to	O
the	O
following	O
risks	O
from	O
their	O
use	O
of	O
financial	O
instruments	O
:	O
s	O
	O

credit	O
risk	O
,	O
	O

liquidity	O
risk	O
,	O
and	O
r	O
	O

market	O
risk	O
(	O
including	O
gold	O
price	O
risk	O
,	O
interest	O
rate	O
and	O
currency	O
risk	O
)	O
.	O

e	O
This	O
note	O
presents	O
information	O
about	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
exposure	O
to	O
each	O
of	O
the	O
above	O
risks	O
,	O
their	O
objectives	O
,	O
policies	O
and	O
processes	O
for	O
measuring	O
and	O
managing	O
risk.	O
The	O
Board	O
has	O
overall	O
p	O
responsibility	O
for	O
the	O
establishment	O
and	O
oversight	O
of	O
the	O
risk	O
management	O
framework.	O
The	O
Board	O
reviews	O
and	O
agrees	O
policies	O
for	O
managing	O
each	O
of	O
these	O
risks	O
and	O
they	O
are	O
summarised	O
below.	O
The	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
principal	O
financial	O
instruments	O
comprise	O
cash.	O
The	O
main	O
purpose	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
instruments	O
is	O
to	O
earn	O
the	O
maximum	O
amount	O
of	O
interest	O
at	O
a	O
low	O
risk	O
to	O
the	O
Company.	O
r	O
The	O
Company	O
also	O
has	O
other	O
financial	O
instruments	O
such	O
as	O
receivables	O
and	O
payables	O
which	O
arise	O
o	O

directly	O
from	O
its	O
operations.	O
For	O
the	O
year	O
under	O
review	O
,	O
it	O
has	O
been	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
policy	O
not	O
to	O
trade	O
in	O
financial	O
instruments.	O
F	O
18	O
On	O
15	O
September	O
2020	O
the	O
Company	O
granted	O
3	O
,	O
000	O
,	O
000	O

performance	O
rights	O
,	O

September	O

to	O
Adam	O

o	O

the	O

the	O
asset's	O
lifetime	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
that	O
is	O
attributable	O
to	O
a	O
default	O
event	O
that	O
is	O
possible	O
within	O
the	O
next	O
12	O
months.	O
Where	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
e	O
has	O
become	O
credit	O
impaired	O
or	O
where	O
it	O
is	O
determined	O
that	O
credit	O
risk	O
has	O
increased	O
significantly	O
,	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
asset's	O
lifetime	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses.	O
The	O
amount	O
of	O
expected	O
s	O
credit	O
loss	O
recognised	O
is	O
measured	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
the	O
probability	O
weighted	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
anticipated	O
cash	O
shortfalls	O
over	O
the	O
life	O
of	O
the	O
instrument	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
original	O
effective	O
u	O
interest	O
rate.	O
For	O
financial	O
assets	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
,	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
recognised	O
within	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O
In	O
all	O
other	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
l	O

and	O
contingencies	O

at	O
the	O
reporting	O

n	O

o	O

of	O

we	O
do	O
not	O

any	O
form	O
of	O
nassurance	O
conclusion	O
thereon.	O
oIn	O

is	O
to	O

,	O

financial	O

s	O

e	O
Responsibilities	O
of	O
the	O
Directors	O
for	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
p	O
The	O
directors	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
that	O
gives	O
a	O
true	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001	O
and	O
for	O
such	O
internal	O
control	O
as	O
the	O
directors	O
determine	O
is	O
necessary	O
to	O
enable	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
that	O
gives	O
a	O
true	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
and	O
is	O
free	O
r	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error.	O
o	O

In	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
,	O
the	O
directors	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
assessing	O
the	O
ability	O
of	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
to	O
continue	O
Fas	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
disclosing	O
,	O
as	O
applicable	O
,	O
matters	O
related	O
to	O
going	O
concern	O
and	O
using	O
the	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
of	O
accounting	O
unless	O
the	O
directors	O
either	O
intend	O
to	O
liquidate	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
or	O
to	O
cease	O
operations	O
,	O
or	O
has	O
no	O
realistic	O
alternative	O
but	O
to	O
do	O
so.	O
Auditor	O
’	O
s	O
Responsibilities	O
for	O
the	O
Audit	O
of	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
Our	O
objectives	O
are	O
to	O
obtain	O
reasonable	O
assurance	O
about	O
whether	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
as	O
a	O
whole	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
,	O
and	O
to	O
issue	O
an	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
report	O
that	O
includes	O
our	O
opinion.	O
Reasonable	O
y	O
assurance	O
is	O
a	O
high	O
level	O
of	O
assurance	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
guarantee	O
that	O
an	O
audit	O
conducted	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
Australian	O
Auditing	O
Standards	O
will	O
always	O
detect	O
a	O
material	O
misstatement	O
when	O
it	O
exists.	O
Misstatements	O
can	O
arise	O
from	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
l	O
and	O
are	O
considered	O
material	O
if	O
,	O
individually	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
aggregate	O
,	O
they	O
could	O
reasonably	O
be	O
expected	O
to	O
influence	O
the	O
n	O
economic	O
decisions	O
of	O
users	O
taken	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
this	O
financial	O
report	O
o	O

As	O
part	O
of	O
an	O
audit	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
Australian	O
Auditing	O
Standards	O
,	O
we	O
exercise	O
professional	O
judgement	O
and	O
maintain	O
professional	O
scepticism	O
throughout	O
the	O
audit.	O
We	O
also	O
:	O
e	O
•	O

Identify	O
and	O
assess	O
the	O
risks	O
of	O
material	O
misstatement	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
,	O
design	O
and	O
perform	O
audit	O
procedures	O
responsive	O
to	O
those	O
risks	O
,	O
and	O
obtain	O
audit	O
evidence	O
that	O
is	O
sufficient	O
and	O
appropriate	O
to	O
provide	O
a	O
basis	O
for	O
our	O
opinion.	O
The	O
risk	O
of	O
not	O
detecting	O
a	O
material	O
misstatement	O
resulting	O
from	O
s	O
fraud	O
is	O
higher	O
than	O
for	O
one	O
resulting	O
from	O
error	O
,	O
as	O
fraud	O
may	O
involve	O
collusion	O
,	O
forgery	O
,	O
intentional	O
omissions	O
,	O
misrepresentations	O
,	O
or	O
the	O
override	O
of	O
internal	O
control.	O
u	O
•	O

Obtain	O
an	O
understanding	O
of	O
internal	O
control	O
relevant	O
to	O
the	O
audit	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
design	O
audit	O
procedures	O
that	O
are	O
appropriate	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
expressing	O
an	O
opinion	O
on	O
the	O
effectiveness	O
of	O
the	O
l	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
’	O
s	O
internal	O
control.	O
a	O
•	O

Evaluate	O
the	O

of	O
accounting	O
policies	O

of	O

n	O

’	O

o	O

the	O

evidence	O

,	O

exists	O

r	O

o	O

within	O

Anne	O
’	O
s	O
mineralisation	O
consists	O
of	O
quartz	O
veining	O
and	O
pyrite	O
alteration	O
(	O
as	O
seen	O
at	O
Turnberry	O
)	O
and	O
occurs	O
on	O
a	O

contact	O
between	O
mafic	O
dolerite	O
and	O
sedimentary	O
shales.	O

rock	O
type	O
’	O

host	O
mineralisation	O
at	O

the	O
dolerite	O
generally	O

of	O

ABOUT	O
LATITUDE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
Latitude	O
Consolidated	O
(	O
ASX	O
:	O
LCD	O
)	O
is	O
a	O
junior	O
gold	O
explorer	O
with	O
a	O
portfolio	O
of	O
exploration	O
projects	O
across	O
Western	O
Australia.	O
Latitude	O
’	O
s	O
flagship	O
Murchison	O
Gold	O
Project	O
has	O
a	O
combined	O
343km	O
²	O

landholding	O
in	O
the	O
prolific	O
Murchison	O
Gold	O
Fields	O
of	O
Western	O
Australia	O
and	O
hosts	O
a	O
large	O
high	O
grade	O
1.1Moz	O
Mineral	O
Resource.	O
The	O
company	O
is	O
actively	O
exploring	O
on	O
this	O
tenure	O
while	O
also	O
progressing	O
mining	O
studies	O
to	O
determine	O
the	O
best	O
pathway	O
to	O
production.	O
The	O
Circle	O
Valley	O
project	O
in	O
southern	O
WA	O
sits	O
in	O
the	O
Albany	O
Fraser	O
mobile	O
belt.	O
This	O
belt	O
is	O
also	O
home	O
to	O
the	O
Tropicana	O
gold	O
mine	O
(	O

)	O

to	O
the	O

gamma	O

handheld	O

,	O

These	O
•	O

Diamond	O
core	O
(	O
BQ	O
)	O
sampled	O
whole	O
examples	O
should	O
not	O
be	O
taken	O
as	O
core	O
,	O

limiting	O

to	O

•	O

and	O

;	O

of	O
the	O
determination	O
of	O
•	O

Mineralisation	O
determined	O
qualitatively	O
mineralisation	O
that	O
are	O
Material	O
to	O
the	O
through	O
:	O
presence	O
of	O
sulphide	O
and	O
Public	O
Report.	O
visible	O
gold	O
in	O
quartz	O
;	O
internal	O
structure	O
(	O
massive	O
,	O
brecciated	O
,	O
laminated	O
)	O
of	O
quartz.	O
•	O

Mineralisation	O
determined	O
quantitatively	O
via	O
fire	O
assay	O
and	O
aqua	O
regia	O
assay	O
methods.	O
•	O

cases	O
where	O
‘	O
industry	O
standard	O
’	O
•	O

Diamond	O
core	O
samples	O
crushed	O
to	O
work	O
has	O
been	O
done	O
this	O
would	O
be	O
2mm	O
and	O
pulverized	O
to	O
75	O
µ	O

m.	O
relatively	O
simple	O
(	O
e.g.	O
‘	O
reverse	O
•	O

RC	O
samples	O
1m	O

by	O
50g	O

circulation	O

was	O

1	O

and	O

from	O

kg	O
was	O
•	O

observed	O
in	O
RC	O

a	O

for	O

is	O

information.	O

•	O

Drill	O
type	O
(	O
e.g.	O

,	O

,	O
•	O

PQ	O
,	O

Overview	O

(	O

)	O
.	O

’	O
s	O

package	O

,	O
Farr-Jones	O
,	O

by	O

Greenstones	O
from	O
the	O
Norseman	O
to	O
Wiluna	O
Greenstone	O
belt	O
,	O
one	O

in	O
the	O

,	O

multiple	O

Kurnalpi	O

of	O
Quarterback	O

Services	O
(	O
Quarterback	O
)	O
,	O
a	O
group	O
of	O
highly	O
successful	O
gold	O
explorers	O
,	O

on	O
an	O

“	O

basis.	O
Target	O
Identification	O
and	O
Initial	O
Soil	O
Sampling	O
Program	O
In	O
July	O
2020	O
,	O
Quarterback	O
undertook	O
a	O
program	O
of	O
reprocessing	O
and	O
reinterpretation	O
of	O
all	O
the	O
airborne	O
magnetic	O
data	O
publicly	O
available	O
for	O
the	O
Kurnalpi	O
area.	O
This	O
reinterpretation	O
work	O
lead	O
to	O
the	O
identification	O
of	O
more	O
than	O
40	O
magnetic	O
targets	O
in	O
the	O
Kurnalpi	O
Project.	O
Following	O
up	O
on	O
the	O
magnetics	O
reinterpretation	O
,	O
remote	O
sensing	O
regolith	O
terrain	O
interpretation	O
was	O
finalised	O
over	O
the	O
whole	O
Kurnalpi	O
Project	O
with	O
a	O
focus	O
on	O
the	O
40	O
newly	O
interpreted	O
magnetic	O
targets.	O
This	O
regolith	O
terrain	O
interpretation	O
exercise	O
deemed	O
17	O
of	O
the	O
40	O
targets	O
amenable	O
to	O
surface	O
sampling	O
as	O
a	O
first	O
pass	O
exploration	O
tool.	O
Commencing	O
in	O
August	O
2020	O
,	O
Riversgold	O
mobilised	O
a	O
team	O
of	O
samplers	O
to	O
the	O
Kurnalpi	O
Project	O
and	O
collected	O
4	O
,	O
280	O
soil	O
samples	O
across	O
the	O
17	O
targets	O
over	O
a	O
6	O
week	O
period.	O
The	O
survey	O
covered	O
15	O
separate	O
grids	O
taking	O
in	O
17	O
geophysical	O
targets	O
with	O
samples	O
collected	O
every	O
40m	O
on	O
lines	O
spaced	O
between	O
200m	O
and	O
400m	O
apart.	O
The	O
lines	O
were	O
designed	O
to	O
cut	O
the	O
inferred	O
geological	O
trends	O
perpendicularly	O
and	O
were	O
positioned	O
so	O
that	O
they	O
covered	O
the	O
most	O
suitable	O
regolith	O
terrain	O
setting	O
over	O
the	O
geophysical	O
target	O
,	O
where	O
bedrock	O
is	O
interpreted	O
to	O
be.	O
The	O
15	O
grids	O
covered	O
both	O
existing	O
and	O
new	O
prospects	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
provide	O
a	O
calibration	O
and	O
check	O
of	O
prior	O
work	O
,	O
expand	O
the	O

a	O

campaigns	O

over	O
the	O
past	O
decades	O
by	O
previous	O
explorers.	O
Cutler	O
Drilling	O
Program	O
In	O
December	O
2020	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
commenced	O
a	O
1	O
,	O
500m	O
RC	O
drilling	O
program	O
at	O
Cutler.	O
Riversgold	O
is	O
using	O
its	O
access	O
to	O
the	O
DetectORETM	O
technology	O
to	O
scan	O
through	O
the	O
drilling	O
samples	O
and	O
optimize	O
the	O
assays	O
process	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
fast	O
track	O
results.	O
DetectORETM	O
allows	O
the	O
detection	O
of	O
low-level	O
gold	O
concentrations	O
(	O
down	O
to	O
~10ppb	O
)	O
using	O
a	O
conventional	O
portable	O
XRF	O
analyser.	O
PPPB	O
is	O
developing	O
the	O
technology	O
and	O
Riversgold	O
will	O
have	O
the	O
highest	O
priority	O
to	O
the	O
technology	O
and	O
will	O
be	O
the	O
first	O
junior	O
explorer	O
to	O
gain	O
access	O
to	O
the	O
many	O
gold	O
sponsor	O
benefits	O
,	O
including	O
field	O
trials	O
and	O
a	O
large	O
number	O
of	O
the	O
single	O
shot	O
consumables	O
(	O
“	O
widgets	O
”	O
)	O
used	O
by	O
the	O
technique.	O
DetectORETM	O
can	O
be	O
used	O
on	O
all	O
types	O
of	O
samples	O
as	O
a	O
first	O
pass	O
qualitative	O
filter	O
and	O
a	O
selection	O
tool	O
for	O
samples	O
prior	O
to	O
the	O
costly	O
use	O
of	O
conventional	O
assay	O
techniques.	O
Riversgold	O
sees	O
a	O
tremendous	O
amount	O
of	O
value	O
in	O
being	O
able	O
to	O
obtain	O
a	O
qualitative	O
result	O
in	O
the	O
field	O
and	O
less	O
than	O
24hours	O
after	O
collection	O
of	O
the	O
samples.	O
The	O
quick	O
turnaround	O
time	O
and	O
portability	O
mean	O
that	O
sampling	O
programs	O
can	O
be	O
extended	O
,	O
infilled	O
,	O
redirected	O
whilst	O
sampling	O
crews	O
are	O
still	O
in	O
the	O
field	O
,	O
saving	O
the	O
substantial	O
mobilization	O
and	O
demobilisation	O
costs.	O
Figure	O
7	O
:	O
Portable	O
PPB	O
mobile	O
facility	O
near	O
Cutler	O
x	O
A	O
new	O
3D	O
interpretation	O
of	O
the	O
available	O
drilling	O
data	O
by	O
Quarterback	O
and	O
Riversgold	O
staff	O
has	O
identified	O
a	O
northerly	O
to	O
northeasterly	O
plunge	O
to	O
the	O
mineralisation.	O
The	O
new	O
data	O
views	O
and	O
interpretation	O
indicate	O
that	O
mineralisation	O
is	O
more	O
likely	O
to	O
be	O
dipping	O
to	O
the	O
east	O
and	O
that	O
most	O
of	O
the	O
previous	O
drilling	O
was	O
completed	O
from	O
west	O
to	O
east	O
and	O
thus	O
would	O
have	O
failed	O
to	O
adequately	O
test	O
the	O
mineralised	O
structures.	O
During	O
the	O
2018	O
drill	O
program	O
,	O
the	O
most	O
northerly	O
hole	O
(	O
CURC0006	O
)	O
failed	O
to	O
intercept	O
mineralisation	O
and	O
would	O
appear	O
to	O
close	O
out	O
the	O
Cutler	O
mineralised	O
structure	O
to	O
the	O
north.	O
However	O
,	O
using	O
the	O
new	O
interpretation	O
and	O
insights	O
it	O
seems	O
likely	O
that	O
CURC0006	O
was	O
drilled	O
above	O
the	O
high	O
grade	O
shoot	O
and	O
hence	O
did	O
not	O
intercept	O
mineralisation.	O
The	O
new	O
drilling	O
will	O
test	O
this	O
hypothesis	O
along	O
with	O
other	O
concepts	O
and	O
down	O
plunge	O
and	O
dip	O
extensions.	O
The	O
Cutler	O
prospect	O
was	O
identified	O
in	O
the	O
late	O
1990	O
’	O
s	O
by	O
a	O
single	O
point	O
soil	O
anomaly	O
on	O
broad	O
spaced	O
regional	O
lines.	O
RAB	O
and	O
aircore	O
drilling	O
further	O
defined	O
a	O
500m	O
long	O
mineralised	O
corridor	O

Expected	O
Results	O
of	O
Operations	O
The	O
Company	O
expects	O
to	O
continue	O
its	O
exploration	O
programs	O
at	O
the	O
Kurnalpi	O
gold	O
project	O
in	O
Western	O
Australia.	O
Disclosure	O
of	O
any	O
further	O
information	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
included	O
in	O
this	O
report	O
because	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
reasonable	O
opinion	O
of	O
the	O
Directors	O
to	O
do	O
so	O
would	O
be	O
likely	O
to	O
prejudice	O
the	O
business	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
and	O
is	O
dependent	O
upon	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
the	O
future	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation.	O
Environmental	O
Regulation	O
and	O
Performance	O
The	O
Group	O
holds	O
various	O
exploration	O
licences	O
and	O
permits	O
to	O
regulate	O
its	O
exploration	O
activities.	O
These	O
licences	O
include	O
conditions	O
and	O
regulations	O
with	O
respect	O
to	O
the	O
rehabilitation	O
of	O
areas	O
disturbed	O
during	O
the	O
course	O
of	O
its	O
exploration	O
activities.	O

far	O

the	O
Directors	O
are	O
aware	O

exploration	O
activities	O
have	O
been	O
undertaken	O
in	O
compliance	O
with	O
all	O
relevant	O
environmental	O
regulations.	O

)	O
Remuneration	O

Directors	O
and	O
Officers	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
is	O
set	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
such	O

made	O
by	O
other	O
ASX	O
listed	O
companies	O
of	O
a	O
similar	O
size	O
and	O
operating	O
in	O
the	O
mineral	O
exploration	O
industry.	O
In	O
addition	O
,	O
reference	O
is	O
made	O
to	O
the	O
specific	O
skills	O
and	O
experience	O
of	O
the	O
Directors	O
and	O
Officers.	O
Details	O
of	O
the	O
nature	O
and	O
amount	O
of	O
remuneration	O
of	O
each	O
Director	O
,	O
and	O
other	O
Key	O
Management	O
Personnel	O
if	O
applicable	O
,	O
are	O
disclosed	O
annually	O
in	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
Annual	O
Report.	O
Remuneration	O
Committee	O
The	O
Board	O
has	O
adopted	O
a	O
formal	O
Remuneration	O
Committee	O
Charter	O
which	O
provides	O
a	O
framework	O
for	O
the	O
consideration	O
of	O
remuneration	O
matters.	O
The	O
Company	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
a	O
separate	O
remuneration	O
committee	O
and	O
as	O
such	O
all	O
remuneration	O
matters	O
are	O
considered	O
by	O
the	O
Board	O
as	O
a	O
whole	O
,	O
with	O
no	O
member	O
deliberating	O
or	O
considering	O
such	O
matter	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
their	O
own	O
remuneration.	O
In	O
the	O
absence	O
of	O
a	O
separate	O
Remuneration	O
Committee	O
,	O
the	O
Board	O
is	O
responsible	O
for	O
:	O
1.	O
Setting	O
remuneration	O
packages	O
for	O
Executive	O
Directors	O
,	O
Non-executive	O
Directors	O
and	O
other	O
Key	O
Management	O
Personnel	O
;	O
and	O
2.	O
Implementing	O
employee	O
incentive	O
and	O
equity	O
based	O
plans	O
and	O
making	O
awards	O
pursuant	O
to	O
those	O
plans.	O
Non-executive	O
Remuneration	O
The	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
policy	O
is	O
to	O
remunerate	O
Non-executive	O
Directors	O
,	O
at	O
rates	O
comparable	O
to	O
other	O
ASX	O
listed	O
companies	O
in	O
the	O
same	O
industry	O
,	O
for	O
their	O
time	O
,	O
commitment	O
and	O
responsibilities.	O
Non-executive	O
Remuneration	O
is	O
not	O
linked	O
to	O
the	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
,	O
however	O
to	O
align	O
Directors	O
’	O
interests	O
with	O
shareholders	O
’	O
interests	O
,	O
remuneration	O
may	O
be	O
provided	O
to	O
Non-executive	O
Directors	O
in	O
the	O
form	O
of	O
equity	O
based	O
long	O
term	O
incentives.	O
1.	O
Fees	O
payable	O
to	O
Non-executive	O
Directors	O
are	O
set	O
within	O
the	O
aggregate	O
amount	O
approved	O
by	O
shareholders	O
at	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
Annual	O
General	O
Meeting	O
;	O
2.	O
Non-executive	O
Directors	O
’	O
fees	O
are	O
payable	O
in	O
the	O
form	O
of	O
cash	O
and	O
superannuation	O
benefits	O
;	O
3.	O
Non-executive	O
superannuation	O
benefits	O
are	O
limited	O
to	O
statutory	O
superannuation	O
entitlements	O
;	O
and	O
4.	O

in	O

based	O

by	O

is	O

and	O

by	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
shareholders.	O
The	O
maximum	O
Non-executive	O

in	O

currently	O
set	O
at	O
$200	O
,	O
000	O
per	O
annum.	O
Executive	O
Director	O
and	O
Other	O
Key	O
Management	O
Personnel	O
Remuneration	O
Executive	O
remuneration	O
consists	O
of	O
base	O
salary	O
,	O
plus	O
other	O
performance	O
incentives	O
to	O
ensure	O
that	O
:	O
1.	O

to	O

to	O
corporate	O
and	O
individual	O

market	O
rates	O

based	O
on	O

ASX	O
listed	O
companies	O
)	O
and	O
are	O
reviewed	O
regularly	O
to	O
ensure	O
market	O

to	O

Each	O
year	O
,	O
the	O
Non-executive	O
Directors	O
set	O
the	O
Key	O
Performance	O
Indicators	O
(	O
KPIs	O
)	O
for	O
Executive	O
Directors.	O
The	O
KPIs	O
are	O
chosen	O
to	O
align	O
the	O
reward	O
of	O
the	O
individual	O
Executives	O
to	O
the	O
strategy	O
and	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
Company.	O
Performance	O
objectives	O
,	O
which	O
may	O
be	O
financial	O
or	O
non-financial	O
,	O
or	O
a	O
combination	O
of	O
both	O
,	O
are	O
weighted	O
when	O
calculating	O
the	O
maximum	O
short	O
term	O
incentives	O
payable	O
to	O
Executives.	O
At	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
year	O
,	O
the	O

executive	O
Directors	O
will	O
assess	O
the	O
actual	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
Executives	O
against	O
the	O
set	O
Performance	O
Objectives.	O
The	O
maximum	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
Short	O
Term	O
Incentive	O
,	O
or	O
a	O
lesser	O
amount	O
depending	O
on	O
actual	O
performance	O
achieved	O
is	O
paid	O
to	O
the	O
Executives	O
as	O
a	O
cash	O
payment.	O
No	O
Short-Term	O
incentives	O
are	O
payable	O
to	O
Executives	O
where	O
it	O
is	O
considered	O
that	O
the	O
actual	O
performance	O
has	O
fallen	O
below	O
the	O
minimum	O
requirement.	O

against	O
all	O

Note	O
1	O
Summary	O
of	O
significant	O
accounting	O
policies	O
Riversgold	O
Limited	O
(	O
‘	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
)	O
is	O
a	O
listed	O
public	O
company	O
domiciled	O
in	O
Australia.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
report	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
for	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
comprises	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
(	O
together	O
referred	O
to	O
as	O
the	O
‘	O
Group	O
’	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
following	O
is	O
a	O
summary	O
of	O
the	O
material	O
accounting	O
policies	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
Group	O
in	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report.	O
The	O
accounting	O
policies	O
have	O
been	O
consistently	O
applied	O
,	O
unless	O
otherwise	O
stated.	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
Basis	O
of	O
preparation	O
This	O
general	O
purpose	O
financial	O
report	O
has	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
equivalents	O
to	O
International	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
(	O
AIFRS	O
)	O
,	O
other	O
authoritative	O
pronouncements	O
of	O
the	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
and	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001.The	O
Group	O
is	O
a	O
for-profit	O
entity	O
for	O
financial	O
reporting	O
purposes	O
under	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards.	O
The	O
financial	O
report	O
is	O
presented	O
in	O
Australian	O
dollars	O
and	O
all	O
values	O
are	O
rounded	O
to	O
the	O
nearest	O
dollar.	O
The	O
financial	O
report	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
was	O
authorised	O
for	O
issue	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
a	O
resolution	O
of	O
Directors	O
on	O
30	O
September	O
2021.	O
Going	O
Concern	O
These	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
on	O
the	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
which	O
contemplates	O
the	O
continuity	O
of	O
normal	O
business	O
activities	O
and	O
the	O
realisation	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
discharge	O
of	O
liabilities	O
in	O
the	O
normal	O
course	O
of	O
business.	O
For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
incurred	O
an	O
operating	O
loss	O
of	O
$1	O
,	O
634	O
,	O
151	O
and	O
had	O
net	O
operating	O
cash	O
outflows	O
of	O
$905	O
,	O
530.	O
The	O
Directors	O
recognise	O
the	O
Group	O
is	O
dependent	O
on	O
capital	O
raising	O
to	O
meet	O
expenditure	O
forecasts.	O
The	O
Directors	O
are	O
of	O
the	O
opinion	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O
is	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
as	O
it	O
expects	O
to	O
be	O
paid	O
the	O
remaining	O
amounts	O
receivable	O
for	O
the	O
sale	O
of	O
the	O
Alaskan	O
Afranex	O
Project	O
as	O
disclosed	O
in	O
note	O
16	O
,	O
while	O
expenditures	O
can	O
be	O
reduced	O
to	O
meet	O
funds	O
available.	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
cash	O
of	O
$294	O
,	O
434	O
as	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
and	O
net	O
current	O
assets	O
of	O
$1	O
,	O
214	O
,	O
233	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2021.	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
received	O
an	O
additional	O
$US400	O
,	O
000	O
or	O
$AUD539	O
,	O
499	O
from	O
the	O
Alaskan	O
Afranex	O
sale	O
proceeds	O
since	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
and	O
is	O
due	O
to	O
receive	O
a	O
further	O
$US600	O
,	O
000	O
or	O
$AUD798	O
,	O
084	O
before	O
completion	O
of	O
the	O
sale.	O
Should	O
the	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
receive	O
expected	O
funds	O
from	O
the	O
Alaskan	O
Afranex	O
sale	O
and	O
cannot	O
raise	O
further	O
funds	O
as	O
required	O
or	O
reduce	O
expenditure	O
to	O
meet	O
funds	O
available	O
,	O
there	O
exists	O
a	O
material	O
uncertainty	O
that	O
may	O
cast	O
significant	O
doubt	O
on	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
it	O
may	O
be	O
required	O
to	O
realise	O
its	O
assets	O
and	O
extinguish	O
its	O
liabilities	O
other	O
than	O
in	O
the	O
ordinary	O
course	O
of	O
business	O
,	O
and	O
at	O
amounts	O
that	O
differ	O
from	O
those	O
stated	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
This	O
financial	O
report	O
does	O
not	O
include	O
any	O
adjustments	O
relating	O
to	O
the	O
recoverability	O
and	O
classification	O
of	O
recorded	O
asset	O
amounts	O
or	O
the	O
amounts	O
or	O
classification	O
of	O
liabilities	O
and	O
appropriate	O
disclosures	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
necessary	O
should	O
the	O
Group	O
be	O
unable	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern.	O
Statement	O
of	O
Compliance	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
report	O
of	O
Riversgold	O
Limited	O
complies	O
with	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
,	O
which	O
include	O
Australian	O
Equivalents	O
to	O
International	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
(	O
AIFRS	O
)	O
,	O
in	O
their	O
entirety.	O
Compliance	O
with	O
AIFRS	O
ensures	O
that	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
also	O
complies	O
with	O
International	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
(	O
IFRS	O
)	O
in	O
their	O
entirety.	O
23	O
ABN	O
64	O
617	O
614	O
598	O
Notes	O
to	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Financial	O
Statements	O
For	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
Note	O
1	O
Summary	O
of	O
significant	O
accounting	O
policies	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
Basis	O
of	O
preparation	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
Adoption	O
of	O
New	O
and	O
Revised	O
Standards	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
applicable	O
to	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
In	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
,	O
the	O
Directors	O
have	O
reviewed	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
and	O
revised	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
AASB	O
that	O
are	O
relevant	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
and	O
effective	O
for	O
the	O
current	O
annual	O
reporting	O
period.	O
As	O
a	O
result	O
of	O
this	O
review	O
,	O
the	O
Directors	O
have	O
determined	O
that	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
material	O
impact	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
and	O
revised	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
on	O
the	O
Group.	O
The	O
adoption	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
Conceptual	O
Framework	O
for	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
from	O
1	O
July	O
2020	O
has	O
not	O
led	O
to	O
any	O
changes	O
in	O
accounting	O
or	O
disclosure	O
for	O
the	O
Group	O
,	O
but	O
the	O
new	O
Conceptual	O
Framework	O
may	O
be	O
referred	O
to	O
if	O
accounting	O
matters	O
arise	O
that	O
are	O
not	O
addressed	O
by	O
accounting	O
standards.	O
The	O
adoption	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
definition	O
of	O
material	O
included	O
in	O
AASB	O
2018-7	O
Amendments	O
to	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
–	O

Definition	O
of	O
Material	O
from	O
1	O
July	O
2020	O
provides	O
a	O
new	O
definition	O
of	O
material	O
,	O
which	O
now	O
extends	O
materiality	O
consideration	O
to	O
obscuration	O
and	O
clarifies	O
that	O
materiality	O
now	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
nature	O
or	O
magnitude	O
of	O
information.	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
in	O
issue	O
not	O
yet	O
effective	O
Certain	O
new	O
accounting	O
standards	O
and	O
interpretations	O
have	O
been	O
published	O
that	O
are	O
not	O
mandatory	O
for	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021.	O
The	O
Company	O
has	O
reviewed	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
standards	O
and	O
interpretations	O
in	O
issue	O
not	O
yet	O
effective	O
and	O
has	O
assessed	O
that	O
these	O
will	O
not	O
have	O
a	O
material	O
effect	O
on	O
the	O
Company.	O
The	O
Company	O
does	O
not	O
plan	O
to	O
adopt	O
these	O
standards	O
early.	O
Reporting	O
basis	O
and	O
conventions	O
These	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
under	O
the	O
historical	O
cost	O
convention	O
,	O
and	O
on	O
an	O
accrual	O
basis.	O
Critical	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
The	O
preparation	O
of	O
financial	O
statements	O
in	O
conformity	O
with	O
AIFRS	O
requires	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
certain	O
critical	O
accounting	O
estimates.	O
It	O
also	O
requires	O
management	O
to	O
exercise	O
its	O
judgement	O
in	O
the	O
process	O
of	O
applying	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
accounting	O
policies.	O
The	O
areas	O
involving	O
a	O
higher	O
degree	O
of	O
judgement	O
or	O
complexity	O
,	O
or	O
areas	O
where	O
assumptions	O
and	O
estimates	O
are	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
,	O
are	O
disclosed	O
in	O
note	O
3.	O
Principles	O
of	O
consolidation	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
of	O
subsidiary	O
companies	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
control	O
commences	O
until	O
the	O
date	O
control	O
ceases.	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
of	O
subsidiary	O
companies	O
are	O
prepared	O
for	O
the	O
same	O
reporting	O
period	O
as	O
the	O
parent	O
company	O
,	O
using	O
consistent	O
accounting	O

Revenue	O
The	O
revenue	O
recognised	O
in	O
any	O
period	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
delivery	O
of	O
performance	O
obligations	O
and	O
an	O
assessment	O
of	O
when	O
control	O
is	O
transferred	O
to	O
the	O
customer.	O
Revenue	O
is	O
recognised	O
either	O
when	O
the	O
performance	O
obligation	O
in	O
the	O
contract	O
has	O
been	O
performed	O
,	O
so	O
“	O
point	O
in	O
time	O
”	O
recognition	O
or	O
“	O
over	O
time	O
”	O
as	O
control	O
of	O
the	O
performance	O
obligation	O
is	O
transferred	O
to	O
the	O
customer.	O
Income	O
is	O
only	O
classifiable	O
as	O
revenue	O
from	O
contracts	O
with	O
customers	O
if	O
the	O
income	O
is	O
from	O
agreed	O
commercial	O
contracts	O
with	O
specified	O
rights	O
to	O
assets	O
or	O
services	O
to	O
be	O
transferred	O
,	O
specified	O
payment	O
terms	O
,	O
probable	O
payment	O
by	O
the	O
customer	O
,	O
and	O
have	O
consideration	O
exchanged	O
for	O
assets	O
or	O
services	O
that	O
are	O
an	O
output	O
of	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
ordinary	O
activities.	O
Sales	O
of	O
assets	O
that	O
are	O
not	O

of	O

’	O

ordinary	O
activities	O
are	O
outside	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
revenue.	O

proportionate	O
basis	O
and	O
is	O

as	O
it	O

d	O
)	O
Income	O
tax	O
The	O
income	O
tax	O
expense	O
or	O
revenue	O
for	O
the	O
period	O
is	O
the	O
tax	O
payable	O
on	O
the	O
current	O
period	O
’	O
s	O
taxable	O
income	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
national	O
income	O
tax	O
rate	O
for	O
each	O
jurisdiction	O
adjusted	O
by	O
changes	O
in	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
tax	O
bases	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
and	O
their	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
,	O
and	O
to	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
recognised	O
for	O
temporary	O
timing	O
differences	O
at	O
the	O
tax	O
rates	O
expected	O
to	O
apply	O
when	O
the	O
assets	O
are	O
recovered	O
or	O
liabilities	O
are	O
settled	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
those	O
tax	O
rates	O
which	O
are	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantially	O
enacted	O
for	O
each	O
jurisdiction.	O
The	O
relevant	O
tax	O
rates	O
are	O
applied	O
to	O
the	O
cumulative	O
amounts	O
of	O
deductible	O
and	O
taxable	O
temporary	O
differences	O
to	O
measure	O
the	O
deferred	O
tax	O
asset	O
or	O
liability.	O
An	O
exception	O
is	O
made	O
for	O
certain	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
from	O
the	O
initial	O
recognition	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
a	O
liability.	O
No	O
deferred	O
tax	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
those	O
timing	O
differences	O
if	O
they	O
arose	O
in	O
a	O
transaction	O
,	O
other	O
than	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
,	O
that	O
at	O
the	O
time	O
of	O
the	O
transaction	O
did	O
not	O
affect	O
either	O
accounting	O
profit	O
or	O
taxable	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
for	O
deductible	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses	O
only	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
future	O
taxable	O
amounts	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
to	O
utilise	O
those	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
losses.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
not	O
recognised	O
for	O
temporary	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
and	O
tax	O
bases	O
of	O
investments	O
in	O
controlled	O
entities	O
where	O
the	O
parent	O
is	O
able	O
to	O
control	O
the	O
timing	O
of	O
the	O
reversal	O
of	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
the	O
differences	O
will	O
not	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
offset	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
legally	O
enforceable	O
right	O
to	O
offset	O
current	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
and	O
when	O
the	O
deferred	O
tax	O
balances	O
relate	O
to	O
the	O
same	O
taxation	O
authority.	O
Current	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
offset	O
where	O
the	O
entity	O
has	O
a	O
legally	O
enforceable	O
right	O
to	O
offset	O
and	O
intends	O
either	O
to	O
settle	O
on	O
a	O
net	O
basis	O
,	O
or	O
to	O
realise	O
the	O
asset	O
and	O
settle	O
the	O
liability	O
simultaneously.	O
Current	O
and	O
deferred	O
tax	O
balances	O
attributable	O
to	O
amounts	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity	O
are	O
also	O

directly	O
in	O
equity.	O

Leases	O
Right-of-use	O
assets	O
A	O
right-of-use	O
asset	O
is	O
recognised	O
at	O
the	O
commencement	O
date	O
of	O
a	O
lease.	O
The	O
right-of-use	O
asset	O
is	O
measured	O
at	O
cost	O
,	O
which	O
comprises	O
the	O
initial	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
lease	O
liability	O
,	O
adjusted	O
for	O
,	O
as	O
applicable	O
,	O
any	O
lease	O
payments	O
made	O
at	O
or	O
before	O
the	O
commencement	O
date	O
net	O
of	O
any	O
lease	O
incentives	O
received	O
,	O
any	O
initial	O
direct	O
costs	O
incurred	O
,	O
and	O
,	O
except	O
where	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
inventories	O
,	O
an	O
estimate	O
of	O
costs	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
incurred	O
for	O
dismantling	O
and	O
removing	O
the	O
underlying	O
asset	O
,	O
and	O
restoring	O
the	O
site	O
or	O
asset.	O
Right-of-use	O
assets	O
are	O
depreciated	O
on	O
a	O
straight-line	O
basis	O
over	O
the	O
unexpired	O
period	O
of	O
the	O
lease	O
or	O
the	O
estimated	O
useful	O
life	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
,	O
whichever	O
is	O
the	O
shorter.	O
Where	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
expects	O
to	O
obtain	O
ownership	O
of	O
the	O
leased	O
asset	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
lease	O
term	O
,	O
the	O
depreciation	O
is	O
over	O
its	O
estimated	O
useful	O
life.	O
Right-of-use	O
assets	O
are	O
subject	O
to	O
impairment	O
or	O
adjusted	O
for	O
any	O
remeasurement	O
of	O
lease	O
liabilities	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
elected	O
not	O
to	O
recognise	O
a	O
right-of-use	O
asset	O
and	O
corresponding	O
lease	O
liability	O
for	O
short-	O
term	O
leases	O
with	O
terms	O
of	O
12	O
months	O
or	O
less	O
and	O
leases	O
of	O
low-value	O
assets.	O
Lease	O
payments	O
on	O
these	O
assets	O
are	O
expensed	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
as	O
incurred.	O
Lease	O
liabilities	O
A	O
lease	O
liability	O
is	O
recognised	O
at	O
the	O
commencement	O
date	O
of	O
a	O
lease.	O
The	O
lease	O
liability	O
is	O
initially	O
recognised	O
at	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
lease	O
payments	O
to	O
be	O
made	O
over	O
the	O
term	O
of	O
the	O
lease	O
,	O
discounted	O
using	O
the	O
interest	O
rate	O
implicit	O
in	O
the	O
lease	O
or	O
,	O
if	O
that	O
rate	O
cannot	O
be	O
readily	O
determined	O
,	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
incremental	O
borrowing	O
rate.	O
Lease	O
payments	O
comprise	O
of	O
fixed	O
payments	O
less	O
any	O
lease	O
incentives	O
receivable	O
,	O
variable	O
lease	O
payments	O
that	O
depend	O
on	O
an	O
index	O
or	O
a	O
rate	O
,	O
amounts	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
paid	O
under	O
residual	O
value	O
guarantees	O
,	O
exercise	O
price	O
of	O
a	O
purchase	O
option	O
when	O
the	O
exercise	O
of	O
the	O
option	O
is	O
reasonably	O
certain	O
to	O
occur	O
,	O
and	O
any	O
anticipated	O
termination	O
penalties.	O
The	O
variable	O
lease	O
payments	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
depend	O
on	O
an	O
index	O
or	O
a	O
rate	O
are	O
expensed	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
they	O
are	O
incurred.	O
Lease	O
liabilities	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method.	O
The	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
are	O
remeasured	O
if	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
change	O
in	O
the	O
following	O
:	O
future	O
lease	O
payments	O
arising	O
from	O
a	O
change	O
in	O
an	O
index	O
or	O
a	O
rate	O
used	O
;	O
residual	O
guarantee	O
;	O
lease	O
term	O
;	O
certainty	O
of	O
a	O
purchase	O
option	O
and	O
termination	O
penalties.	O
When	O
a	O
lease	O
liability	O
is	O
remeasured	O
,	O
an	O
adjustment	O
is	O
made	O
to	O
the	O
corresponding	O
right-of	O
use	O
asset	O
,	O
or	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
if	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
right-of-use	O
asset	O
is	O
fully	O
written	O
down.	O
(	O
f	O
)	O
Impairment	O
of	O
assets	O
Assets	O
are	O
reviewed	O
for	O
impairment	O
whenever	O
events	O
or	O
changes	O
in	O
circumstances	O
indicate	O
that	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
may	O
not	O
be	O
recoverable.	O
An	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
for	O
the	O
amount	O
by	O
which	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
exceeds	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount.	O
The	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
is	O
the	O
higher	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
fair	O
value	O
less	O
costs	O
to	O
sell	O
and	O
value	O
in	O
use.	O
For	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
assessing	O
impairment	O
,	O
assets	O
are	O
grouped	O
at	O
the	O
lowest	O
levels	O
for	O
which	O
there	O
are	O
separately	O
identifiable	O
cash	O
inflows	O
which	O
are	O
largely	O
independent	O
of	O
the	O
cash	O
inflows	O
from	O
other	O
assets	O
or	O
groups	O
of	O
assets	O
(	O
cash	O
generating	O
units	O
)	O
.	O

Non-	O
financial	O
assets	O
,	O
other	O
than	O
goodwill	O
,	O
that	O

impairment	O
are	O
reviewed	O
for	O
possible	O

of	O
the	O
impairment	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date.	O

h	O
)	O
Government	O
grants	O
Government	O
grants	O
are	O
recognised	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
where	O
there	O
is	O
reasonable	O
assurance	O
that	O
the	O
grant	O
will	O
be	O
received	O
and	O

grant	O
conditions	O
will	O
be	O
met.	O
Grants	O

to	O
expense	O
items	O
are	O
recognised	O
as	O
income	O
over	O
the	O
periods	O
necessary	O
to	O
match	O
the	O
grant	O
to	O
the	O
costs	O
they	O
are	O

Grants	O
relating	O
to	O
assets	O
are	O
deducted	O
from	O
the	O
carrying	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
relevant	O
asset.	O

Office	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
research	O
and	O

concession	O
claims	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
year	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
claim	O
is	O
lodged	O
with	O
the	O
Australian	O
Tax	O
Office.	O

allocated	O

statements	O
against	O
the	O
corresponding	O
expense	O
or	O
asset	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
which	O

research	O
and	O
development	O
concession	O
claim	O
has	O
arisen.	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
Fair	O
value	O
estimation	O
The	O
nominal	O
value	O
less	O
estimated	O
credit	O
loss	O
adjustments	O
of	O
trade	O
receivables	O
and	O
payables	O
are	O
assumed	O
to	O
approximate	O
their	O
fair	O
values.	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
for	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
is	O
estimated	O
by	O
discounting	O
the	O
future	O
contractual	O
cash	O
flows	O
at	O
the	O
current	O
market	O
interest	O
rate	O
that	O
is	O
available	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
for	O
similar	O
financial	O
instruments.	O
(	O
j	O
)	O
Property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
Property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
is	O
stated	O
at	O
historical	O
cost	O
less	O
depreciation.	O
Historical	O
cost	O
includes	O
expenditure	O
that	O
is	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
assets.	O
Subsequent	O
costs	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
or	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
separate	O
asset	O
,	O
as	O
appropriate	O
,	O
only	O
when	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
future	O
economic	O
benefits	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
item	O
will	O
flow	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
and	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
the	O
item	O
can	O
be	O
measured	O
reliably.	O
All	O
other	O
repairs	O
and	O
maintenance	O
are	O
charged	O
to	O
the	O
income	O
statement	O
during	O
the	O
financial	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
they	O
are	O
incurred.	O
Depreciation	O
of	O
property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
is	O
calculated	O
using	O
the	O
straight	O
line	O
and	O
diminishing	O
value	O
methods	O
to	O
allocate	O
their	O
cost	O
,	O
net	O
of	O
residual	O
values	O
,	O
over	O
their	O
estimated	O
useful	O
lives.	O
The	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
residual	O
values	O
and	O
useful	O
lives	O
are	O
reviewed	O
,	O
and	O
adjusted	O
if	O
appropriate	O
,	O
at	O
each	O
balance	O
sheet	O
date.	O
An	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
is	O
written	O
down	O
immediately	O
to	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
if	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
is	O
greater	O
than	O
its	O
estimated	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
(	O
note	O
1	O
(	O
f	O
)	O
)	O
.	O

Gains	O
and	O
losses	O
on	O
disposal	O
are	O
determined	O
by	O
comparing	O
proceeds	O
with	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount.	O
These	O
gains	O
and	O
losses	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

k	O
)	O
Capitalised	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditures	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
each	O
separate	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
are	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
asset	O
in	O
the	O
year	O
in	O
which	O
they	O
are	O
incurred	O
where	O
the	O
following	O
conditions	O
are	O
satisfied	O
:	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
the	O
rights	O
to	O
tenure	O
of	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
are	O
current	O
;	O
and	O
(	O
ii	O
)	O
at	O
least	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
following	O
conditions	O
is	O
also	O
met	O
:	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
the	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditures	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
recouped	O
through	O
successful	O
development	O
and	O

of	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
,	O
or	O
alternatively	O
,	O
by	O
its	O
sale	O
;	O
or	O
(	O
b	O
)	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
activities	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
have	O
not	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
reached	O
a	O
stage	O
which	O
permits	O
a	O
reasonable	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
existence	O
or	O
otherwise	O
of	O
economically	O
recoverable	O
reserves	O
,	O
and	O
active	O
and	O
significant	O
operations	O
in	O
,	O
or	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
are	O
continuing.	O
Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
are	O
initially	O
measured	O
at	O
cost	O
and	O
include	O
acquisition	O
of	O
rights	O
to	O
explore	O
,	O
studies	O
,	O
exploratory	O
drilling	O
,	O
trenching	O
and	O
sampling	O
and	O
associated	O
activities	O
and	O
an	O
allocation	O
of	O
depreciation	O
and	O
amortised	O
of	O
assets	O
used	O
in	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
activities.	O
General	O
and	O
administrative	O
costs	O
are	O
only	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
measurement	O
of	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
costs	O
where	O
they	O
are	O
related	O
directly	O
to	O
operational	O
activities	O
in	O
a	O
particular	O
area	O
of	O
interest.	O
Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
are	O
assessed	O
for	O
impairment	O
when	O
facts	O
and	O
circumstances	O
suggest	O
that	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
an	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
asset	O
may	O
exceed	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount.	O
The	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
asset	O
(	O
for	O
the	O
cash	O
generating	O
unit	O
(	O
s	O
)	O
to	O
which	O
it	O
has	O
been	O
allocated	O
being	O
no	O
larger	O
than	O
the	O
relevant	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
)	O
is	O
estimated	O
to	O
determine	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
loss	O
(	O
if	O
any	O
)	O
.	O

Where	O
an	O
impairment	O
loss	O
subsequently	O
reverses	O
,	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
is	O
increased	O
to	O
the	O
revised	O
estimate	O
of	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
,	O
but	O
only	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
the	O

carrying	O
amount	O
does	O
not	O
exceed	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
that	O
would	O
have	O

had	O
no	O

loss	O
been	O
recognised	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
in	O
previous	O
years.	O
Where	O
a	O

has	O
been	O

to	O

in	O

of	O

is	O

for	O

and	O
the	O
balance	O
is	O
then	O
reclassified	O
to	O
development.	O
Farm-in	O
arrangements	O
(	O
in	O
the	O

and	O

phase	O
)	O
For	O

and	O

Farm-out	O

(	O
in	O
the	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
phase	O
)	O
The	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
record	O
any	O

by	O
the	O
farminee	O
on	O
its	O
accounts.	O
It	O
also	O
does	O
not	O
recognise	O
any	O
gain	O
or	O
loss	O
on	O
its	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O

any	O

to	O

whole	O
interest	O
as	O

to	O
the	O

interest	O

as	O
a	O

until	O

expenditure	O

Joint	O
ventures	O
and	O
joint	O
operations	O
Joint	O
ventures	O
A	O
joint	O
venture	O
is	O
a	O
joint	O
arrangement	O
whereby	O
the	O
parties	O
that	O
have	O
joint	O
control	O
of	O
the	O
arrangement	O
have	O
rights	O
to	O
the	O
net	O
assets	O
of	O
the	O
arrangement.	O
Investments	O
in	O
joint	O
ventures	O
are	O
accounted	O
for	O
using	O
the	O
equity	O
method.	O
Under	O
the	O
equity	O
method	O
,	O
the	O
share	O
of	O
the	O
profits	O
or	O
losses	O
of	O
the	O
joint	O
venture	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
the	O
share	O
of	O
the	O
movements	O
in	O
equity	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O
Investments	O
in	O
joint	O
ventures	O
are	O
carried	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
at	O
cost	O
plus	O
post-acquisition	O
changes	O
in	O
the	O
Group's	O
share	O
of	O
net	O
assets	O
of	O
the	O
joint	O
venture.	O
Goodwill	O
relating	O
to	O
the	O
joint	O
venture	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
investment	O
and	O
is	O
neither	O
amortised	O
nor	O
individually	O
tested	O
for	O
impairment.	O
Income	O
earned	O
from	O
joint	O
venture	O
entities	O
reduce	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
investment.	O
Joint	O
operations	O
A	O
joint	O
operation	O
is	O
a	O
joint	O
arrangement	O
whereby	O
the	O
parties	O
that	O
have	O
joint	O
control	O
of	O
the	O
arrangement	O
have	O
rights	O
to	O
the	O
assets	O
,	O
and	O
obligations	O
for	O
the	O
liabilities	O
,	O
relating	O
to	O
the	O
arrangement.	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
recognised	O
its	O
share	O
of	O
jointly	O
held	O
assets	O
,	O
liabilities	O
,	O
revenues	O
and	O
expenses	O
of	O
joint	O
operations.	O
These	O
have	O
been	O
incorporated	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
under	O
the	O
appropriate	O
classifications.	O
(	O
m	O
)	O
Trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables	O
These	O
amounts	O
represent	O
liabilities	O
for	O
goods	O
and	O
services	O
provided	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
prior	O
to	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
which	O
are	O
unpaid.	O
The	O
amounts	O
are	O
unsecured	O
and	O
usually	O
paid	O
within	O
30	O
days	O
of	O
recognition.	O
Trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables	O
are	O
carried	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost.	O
(	O
n	O
)	O
Employee	O
benefits	O
Wages	O
,	O
salaries	O
and	O
annual	O
leave	O
Liabilities	O
for	O
wages	O
and	O
salaries	O
,	O
including	O
non-monetary	O
benefits	O
,	O
and	O
annual	O
leave	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
settled	O
within	O
12	O
months	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
payables	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
employees	O
’	O
services	O
up	O
to	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
the	O
amounts	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
paid	O
when	O
the	O
liabilities	O
are	O
settled.	O
Long	O
service	O
leave	O
The	O
liability	O
for	O
long	O
service	O
leave	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
provision	O
for	O
employee	O
benefits	O
and	O
measured	O
as	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
expected	O
future	O
payments	O
to	O
be	O
made	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
services	O
provided	O
by	O
employees	O
up	O
to	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
using	O
the	O
projected	O
unit	O
credit	O
method.	O
Consideration	O
is	O
given	O
to	O
expected	O
future	O
salaries	O
,	O
experience	O
of	O
employee	O
departures	O
and	O
periods	O
of	O
service.	O
Expected	O
future	O
payments	O
are	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
corporate	O
bond	O
rate	O
with	O
terms	O
to	O
maturity	O
and	O
currency	O
that	O
match	O
,	O
as	O
closely	O
as	O
possible	O
,	O
the	O
estimated	O
future	O
cash	O
outflows.	O

of	O
significant	O
accounting	O
policies	O

)	O
(	O
o	O

)	O
Share-based	O
payments	O
Share-based	O
payments	O
Share-based	O
payments	O
are	O
made	O
when	O
the	O
Group	O
issues	O
or	O
grants	O
shares	O
,	O
performance	O
rights	O
,	O
share	O
options	O
or	O
cash	O
settled	O
share	O
based	O
payments	O
to	O
counterparties	O
,	O
including	O
directors	O
and	O
employees	O
,	O
in	O
consideration	O
for	O
goods	O
or	O
services.	O
These	O
may	O
be	O
subject	O
to	O
vesting	O
conditions.	O
Fair	O
values	O
of	O
options	O
,	O
performance	O
rights	O
and	O
shares	O
granted	O
are	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
share	O
based	O
payment	O
expense	O
with	O
a	O
corresponding	O
increase	O
in	O
equity	O
unless	O
other	O
classifications	O
are	O
more	O
appropriate.	O
Fair	O
values	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
grant	O
date	O
and	O
recognised	O
over	O
the	O
period	O
during	O
which	O
the	O
counterparty	O
become	O
unconditionally	O
entitled	O
to	O
the	O
share-based	O
payments.	O
Fair	O
values	O
at	O
grant	O
date	O
of	O
share	O
options	O
are	O
determined	O
using	O
a	O
Black-Scholes	O
option	O
pricing	O
model	O
that	O
takes	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
exercise	O
price	O
,	O
the	O
term	O
of	O
the	O
option	O
,	O
the	O
share	O
price	O
at	O
grant	O
date	O
and	O
expected	O
price	O
volatility	O
of	O
the	O
underlying	O
share	O
,	O
the	O
expected	O
dividend	O
yield	O
and	O
the	O
risk	O
free	O
rate	O
for	O
the	O
term	O
of	O
the	O
option.	O
Fair	O
values	O
at	O
grant	O
date	O
of	O
performance	O
rights	O
and	O
shares	O
are	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
closing	O
share	O
price	O
at	O
the	O
grant	O
date.	O
Fair	O
values	O
of	O
share-based	O
payments	O
are	O
adjusted	O
to	O
reflect	O
market	O
based	O
vesting	O
conditions.	O
Non-market	O
vesting	O
conditions	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
assumptions	O
about	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
options	O
that	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
become	O
exercisable.	O
At	O
each	O
balance	O
date	O
,	O
the	O
entity	O
revises	O
its	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
options	O
that	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
become	O
exercisable.	O
The	O
share	O
based	O
payment	O
expense	O
recognised	O
each	O
period	O
takes	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
most	O
recent	O

(	O

)	O
Issued	O

,	O

(	O

)	O
Earnings	O

i	O

Summary	O
of	O
significant	O

(	O

)	O
(	O
s	O
)	O
Goods	O
and	O
services	O
tax	O
(	O
GST	O
)	O
Revenues	O
,	O
expenses	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
net	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
associated	O
GST	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
GST	O
incurred	O
is	O
not	O
recoverable	O
from	O
the	O
taxation	O
authority.	O
In	O
this	O
case	O
it	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
as	O
a	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
expense.	O
Receivables	O
and	O
payables	O
are	O
stated	O
inclusive	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
receivable	O
or	O
payable.	O
The	O
net	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
taxation	O
authority	O
is	O
included	O
with	O
other	O
receivables	O
or	O
payables	O
in	O
the	O
balance	O
sheet.	O
Cash	O
flows	O
are	O
presented	O
on	O
a	O
gross	O
basis.	O
The	O
GST	O
components	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
arising	O
from	O

or	O
financing	O
activities	O
which	O

from	O
,	O
or	O

to	O
,	O
the	O

authority	O
,	O
are	O
presented	O
as	O
operating	O
cash	O
flow.	O
(	O
t	O
)	O
Investments	O
and	O
other	O
financial	O
assets	O
Investments	O
and	O
other	O
financial	O
assets	O
are	O
initially	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value.	O
Transaction	O
costs	O
are	O
included	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
initial	O
measurement	O
,	O
except	O
for	O
financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
Such	O
assets	O
are	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
either	O
amortised	O
cost	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
depending	O
on	O
their	O
classification.	O
Classification	O
is	O
determined	O
based	O
on	O
both	O
the	O
business	O
model	O
within	O
which	O
such	O
assets	O
are	O
held	O
and	O
the	O
contractual	O
cash	O
flow	O
characteristics	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
unless	O
,	O
an	O
accounting	O
mismatch	O
is	O
being	O
avoided.	O
Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
derecognised	O
when	O
the	O
rights	O
to	O
receive	O
cash	O
flows	O
have	O
expired	O
or	O
have	O
been	O
transferred	O
and	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
transferred	O
substantially	O
all	O
the	O
risks	O
and	O
rewards	O
of	O
ownership.	O
When	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
reasonable	O
expectation	O
of	O
recovering	O
part	O
or	O
all	O
of	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
,	O
it's	O
carrying	O
value	O
is	O
written	O
off.	O
Financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
Financial	O
assets	O
not	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
or	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
Typically	O
,	O
such	O

assets	O
will	O
be	O
either	O
:	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
held	O
for	O

,	O

or	O
(	O

)	O

as	O
such	O

initial	O

where	O
permitted.	O
Fair	O
value	O
movements	O
are	O

in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
Financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O

through	O
other	O

income	O
Financial	O

other	O

income	O

as	O

recognition.	O

)	O

t	O
)	O
Investments	O
and	O
other	O
financial	O
assets	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
Impairment	O
of	O
financial	O
assets	O
The	O
Group	O
recognises	O
a	O
loss	O
allowance	O
for	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
on	O
financial	O
assets	O
which	O
are	O
either	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O
The	O
measurement	O
of	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
depends	O
upon	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
assessment	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
each	O
reporting	O
period	O
as	O
to	O
whether	O
the	O
financial	O
instrument's	O
credit	O
risk	O
has	O
increased	O
significantly	O
since	O
initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
reasonable	O
and	O
supportable	O
information	O
that	O
is	O
available	O
,	O
without	O
undue	O
cost	O
or	O
effort	O
to	O
obtain.	O
Where	O
there	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
a	O
significant	O
increase	O
in	O
exposure	O
to	O
credit	O
risk	O
since	O
initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
a	O
12-	O
month	O
expected	O
credit	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
estimated.	O
This	O
represents	O
a	O
portion	O
of	O
the	O
asset's	O
lifetime	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
that	O
is	O
attributable	O
to	O
a	O
default	O
event	O
that	O
is	O
possible	O
within	O
the	O
next	O
12	O
months.	O
Where	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
has	O
become	O
credit	O
impaired	O
or	O
where	O
it	O
is	O
determined	O
that	O
credit	O
risk	O
has	O
increased	O
significantly	O
,	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
asset's	O
lifetime	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses.	O
The	O
amount	O
of	O
expected	O
credit	O
loss	O
recognised	O
is	O
measured	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
the	O
probability	O
weighted	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
anticipated	O
cash	O
shortfalls	O
over	O
the	O
life	O
of	O
the	O
instrument	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
original	O
effective	O
interest	O
rate.	O
For	O
financial	O
assets	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
,	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
recognised	O
within	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O
In	O
all	O
other	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
(	O
u	O
)	O
Fair	O
value	O
estimation	O
A	O
number	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
accounting	O
policies	O
and	O
disclosures	O
require	O
the	O
determination	O
of	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
for	O
both	O
financial	O
and	O
non-financial	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities.	O
Fair	O
values	O
have	O
been	O
determined	O
for	O
measurement	O
and/or	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
following	O
methods	O
:	O
Investments	O
in	O
equity	O
and	O
debt	O
securities	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
is	O
determined	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
their	O
quoted	O
bid	O
price	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date.	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
held	O
to	O
maturity	O
investments	O
is	O
determined	O
for	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
only.	O
For	O
investments	O
with	O
no	O
active	O
market	O
,	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
determined	O
using	O
valuation	O
techniques.	O
Such	O
techniques	O
include	O
using	O
recent	O
arm	O
’	O
s	O
length	O
market	O
transactions	O
,	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
current	O
market	O
value	O
of	O
another	O
instrument	O
that	O
is	O
substantially	O
the	O
same	O
,	O
discounted	O
cash	O
flow	O
analysis	O
and	O
option	O
pricing	O
models.	O
Trade	O
and	O
other	O
receivables	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
trade	O
and	O
other	O
receivables	O
is	O
estimated	O
as	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
,	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
market	O
rate	O
of	O
interest	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date.	O
An	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
calculated	O
as	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
contractual	O
and	O
expected	O
future	O
cashflows.	O
32	O
ABN	O
64	O
617	O
614	O
598	O
Notes	O
to	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Financial	O
Statements	O
For	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
Note	O
1	O
Summary	O
of	O
significant	O
accounting	O
policies	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
(	O
u	O
)	O
Fair	O
value	O
estimation	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
Fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
When	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
financial	O
or	O
non-financial	O
,	O
is	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
for	O
recognition	O
or	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
,	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
price	O
that	O
would	O
be	O
received	O
to	O
sell	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
paid	O
to	O
transfer	O
a	O
liability	O
in	O
an	O
orderly	O
transaction	O
between	O
market	O
participants	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date	O
;	O
and	O
assumes	O
that	O
the	O
transaction	O
will	O
take	O
place	O
either	O
:	O
in	O
the	O
principal	O
market	O
;	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
absence	O
of	O
a	O
principal	O
market	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
most	O
advantageous	O
market.	O
Fair	O
value	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
the	O
assumptions	O
that	O
market	O
participants	O
would	O
use	O
when	O
pricing	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
assuming	O
they	O
act	O
in	O
their	O
economic	O
best	O
interests.	O
For	O
non-financial	O
assets	O
,	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
its	O
highest	O
and	O
best	O
use.	O
Valuation	O
techniques	O
that	O
are	O
appropriate	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
sufficient	O
data	O
are	O
available	O
to	O
measure	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
are	O
used	O
,	O
maximising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
relevant	O
observable	O
inputs	O
and	O
minimising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
unobservable	O
inputs.	O
Assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
are	O
classified	O
,	O
into	O
three	O
levels	O
,	O
using	O
a	O
fair	O
value	O
hierarchy	O
that	O
reflects	O
the	O
significance	O
of	O
the	O
inputs	O
used	O
in	O
making	O
the	O
measurements.	O
Classifications	O
are	O
reviewed	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
transfers	O
between	O
levels	O
are	O
determined	O
based	O
on	O
a	O
reassessment	O
of	O
the	O
lowest	O
level	O
of	O
input	O
that	O
is	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement.	O
For	O
recurring	O
and	O
non-recurring	O
fair	O
value	O
measurements	O
,	O
external	O
valuers	O
may	O
be	O
used	O
when	O
internal	O
expertise	O
is	O
either	O
not	O
available	O
or	O
when	O
the	O
valuation	O
is	O
deemed	O
to	O
be	O
significant.	O
External	O
valuers	O
are	O
selected	O
based	O
on	O
market	O
knowledge	O
and	O
reputation.	O
Where	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
significant	O
change	O
in	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
from	O
one	O
period	O
to	O
another	O
,	O
an	O
analysis	O
is	O
undertaken	O
,	O
which	O
includes	O
a	O
verification	O
of	O
the	O
major	O
inputs	O
applied	O
in	O
the	O
latest	O
valuation	O
and	O
a	O
comparison	O
,	O
where	O
applicable	O
,	O
with	O
external	O
sources	O
of	O
data.	O
(	O
v	O
)	O
Disposal	O
groups	O
and	O
discontinued	O
operations.	O
A	O
disposal	O
group	O
is	O
a	O
group	O
of	O
assets	O
to	O
be	O
disposed	O
of	O
,	O
by	O
sale	O
or	O
otherwise	O
,	O
in	O
a	O
single	O
transaction	O
,	O
along	O
with	O
liabilities	O
directly	O
associated	O
with	O
those	O
assets.	O
Disposal	O
groups	O
are	O

when	O

disposal	O
group	O

net	O

of	O

disposal	O
group	O

the	O

Financial	O
risk	O
management	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
exposure	O
to	O
various	O
risks	O
from	O
its	O
use	O
of	O
financial	O
instruments.	O
This	O
note	O
describes	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
exposure	O
to	O
specific	O
risks	O
,	O
and	O
policies	O
and	O
processes	O
for	O
measuring	O
and	O
managing	O
those	O
risks.	O
The	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
has	O
the	O
overall	O
responsibility	O
for	O
the	O
risk	O
management	O
framework	O
and	O
has	O
adopted	O
a	O
Risk	O
Management	O
Policy.	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
Credit	O
risk	O
Credit	O
risk	O
is	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
financial	O
loss	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
if	O
a	O
customer	O
or	O
counterparty	O
to	O
a	O
financial	O
instrument	O
fails	O
to	O
meet	O
its	O
contractual	O
obligations	O
,	O
and	O
arises	O
principally	O
from	O
transactions	O
with	O
customers	O
and	O
investments.	O
Trade	O
and	O
other	O
receivables	O
The	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
business	O
activity	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
result	O
in	O
trading	O
receivables.	O
The	O
receivables	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O
does	O
experience	O
through	O
its	O
normal	O
course	O
of	O
business	O
are	O
short	O
term	O
and	O
the	O
most	O
significant	O
recurring	O
by	O
quantity	O
is	O
receivable	O
from	O
the	O
Australian	O
Taxation	O
Office	O
,	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
non-	O
recovery	O
of	O
receivables	O
from	O
this	O
source	O
is	O
considered	O
to	O
be	O
negligible.	O
Cash	O
deposits	O
The	O
Directors	O
believe	O
any	O
risk	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
predominantly	O
only	O
one	O
bank	O
is	O

of	O
disposal	O
group	O

3	O

disposal	O
group	O

any	O
impairment.	O
(	O
b	O
)	O
Liquidity	O
risk	O
Liquidity	O
risk	O
is	O
the	O
risk	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O
will	O
not	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
meet	O
its	O
financial	O

fall	O
due.	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
approach	O
to	O

is	O
to	O
ensure	O
,	O
as	O
far	O

possible	O

it	O
will	O
always	O
have	O
sufficient	O
liquidity	O
to	O
meet	O
its	O
liabilities	O
when	O
due	O
,	O
under	O
both	O
normal	O
and	O
stressed	O
conditions	O
,	O
without	O

unacceptable	O
losses	O
or	O
risking	O

to	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
reputation.	O
The	O
Group	O
manages	O
liquidity	O
risk	O
by	O
monitoring	O
cash	O
reserves	O
and	O
forecast	O
spending.	O
Management	O
is	O
cognisant	O
of	O
the	O
future	O
demands	O
for	O
financial	O
resources	O
to	O
finance	O

assets	O

to	O
future	O

or	O
investment.	O
(	O
c	O
)	O
Market	O
risk	O

risk	O
is	O
the	O
risk	O
that	O
changes	O
in	O

,	O
such	O
as	O

exchange	O
rates	O
,	O
interest	O
rates	O
and	O

prices	O
will	O
affect	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
income	O
or	O
the	O
value	O
of	O
its	O
holdings	O
of	O
financial	O
instruments.	O
The	O
objective	O
of	O
market	O
risk	O
management	O
is	O
to	O
manage	O
and	O
control	O
market	O
risk	O
exposures	O
within	O
acceptable	O
parameters	O
,	O
while	O
optimising	O
any	O
return.	O
Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
significant	O
cash	O
assets	O
which	O
may	O

to	O

in	O

in	O

Group	O
